story:
Who I am:

My name is Jim Woodward, and I have been selected to go to Cambodia on a mission trip this summer. The mission trip is through Sanctuary church in Kennesaw, Georgia, and with Saving Susan Ministry.

Why I'm going:

In the 1970's, the Khmer Rouge lead by communist leader Pol Pot, systematically tortured and killed almost 2 million people. This genocide lead to the death of about half of the population of Cambodia and left many as widows and orphans. The economy of Cambodia has struggled to recover ever since. Due to the severe poverty that exists in many of the more rural areas there are currently over half a million orphans in Cambodia. To prevent abuse, exploitation, and human-trafficking Cambodian adoption laws forbid orphans from being adopted by people who live outside of Cambodia. Saving Susan Ministry is a Christian Non-Profit Organization that pairs orphans in Cambodia with "parent partners" outside of Cambodia, in the United States. The parent partners provide financial aid for the orphans, and among other things, they frequently skype and talk to the orphans about things from day to day life, but most importantly the parent partners talk to them about Christianity and the Gospel of Jesus Christ. I will be going to Cambodia as a messenger of Christ preaching the Gospel; reinforcing the work the parent partners have been doing and encouraging others towards a life with Christ.

What I'm doing:

I will be in Cambodia for a little under two weeks, and during my time there I will travel to the Kampong Thom province and work alongside long-term missionaries in their duties at Bileg Solid Rock Baptist Church. I will be witnessing and ministering to children and adults alike. Much to my joy, as a a way to better connect with some of the more energetic middle school aged kids, I will be running mini lacrosse camps during the day too!

Where you come in:

Cutting right to the chase, this trip is expensive and I'm a recent college graduate with no money. Nearly all of the expenses of this trip are for travel. I would love for you to prayerfully consider supporting me financially.
However, there are some other ways you can help me too:
The first thing you can do is to pray for me, those on my team that I will be traveling with, and for the people of Cambodia. Prayer will go further than any other contribution you can make to this trip. 
Secondly, if you have any old lacrosse sticks you have lying around that would want to donate they would be more than welcome. Both girls and guys sticks are okay.
Lastly, if you know anyone who would like to financially support me, pray for us, or donate lacrosse sticks then you can help me spread this and reach those who you know.

I hope that you will support me in, not just one, but as many ways as you can. Thanks, Jim

http://sanctuaryinhim.org/

http://savingsusanministry.org

story:
Why don't they have power?

Blackouts are a regular occurrence in Nepal. From October until July, the coldest and darkest months of the year, the government restricts electricity for up to 16 hours per day. Nepalis have grown to anticipate daily power shortages, consulting load shedding schedules in newspapers and downloading apps for updates. I take for granted the ease in which I can charge my cell phone or flip on a light switch to read at night. 

**NOTE: Donations above and beyond the solar project will be invested into the school to support teachers and develop the new academic program.

What can be done?

At first I suggested a generator to provide electricity for classrooms, dorm hallways, common areas, and kitchen lights. This is before I knew generators are loud and expensive, run on diesel, are NOT environmentally friendly, and emit harmful fumes.

Our sustainable solution

Solar experts in Nepal and America suggested a hybrid solar model to use the existing grid (when it is working) along with solar cells to combat load shedding and provide power. With this system, the monks will be able to light key areas --- library, kitchen, cafeteria, classrooms and puja hall --- for up to two days of blackout. Money saved on candles, torches, generators, electricity bills (40NPR/day is a big deal for the monks) and flashlights can be redirected to teaching salaries.

CLICK HERE for FAQs on Matepani and the solar project.

Our local team

We met with several companies before teaming up with Gham Power, a group of engineers and entrepreneurs with a proven track record. I’m thrilled to support their business and work with a local company championing renewable energy. Their team has taken time to address all presented concerns before developing a proposal with high-quality components, an energy management unit to monitor and record data, and a function that allows for solar energy use during load shedding hours. 

Gham Power is going to provide on-site training during the installation process and a manual (in Nepali!) for maintenance and troubleshooting. They've also guaranteed two years of support to help the monks monitor and maintain the equipment.

To download the complete project proposal and see some of the areas that will benefit, visit our GALLERY.

Rewards for your support

While the final project is estimated at 666,000NPR (1USD = 99.603NPR), we've set our fundraise goal for $8,000USD to account for exchange rates, Indiegogo fees and any unexpected expenses along the way. 

Your support is appreciated, whether monetary or otherwise. You can share, tweet, comment, even send a kind note to our team. Take a look at some of the perks for your participation: 

From left: mala, khata, sung.

A birthday present for Sangpo

Our Project Director, Sangpo, entered the monastery at age eleven. His remarkable intelligence, charisma, and responsible vision is leading our efforts. I'm honored to help him invest in the place he was brought as a young boy to study and live over fifteen years ago. With installation scheduled for early April, we hope to complete construction by his May birthday (and before Nepal's rainy season!).

Visit our UPDATES page for new perks, project news, and team announcements.

Dherai dherai dhannyabad! 

Thank you so much!

story:
I’m Joel Simpson, about to take a ‘round-the-world trip with a fabulous companion, writer, professor, environmental NGO director Dr. Barbara Brodman, focusing mainly on Asia. We’re both adventuresome travelers, with lots of experience under our belts. I’ve lived in four European countries, speak French, Italian and German, and she speaks Spanish and Portuguese. My Ph. D. is in comparative literature, but I also have a masters in music, and I’ve done travel writing, and music and art reviewing. I’m no stranger to large-scale projects. I produced the Dick Hyman Century of Jazz Pinao CD-ROM in 1999, which sold world-wide; and Sun Pictures to Mega-Pixels, a exhibition of archaic process and digital process photography in 2007, that involved 125 artists.

I’ve been a serious photographer since I was 13, a professional for the past 12 years, with publications and shows of my work in the US, France, Australia, and Spain. Barbara and I have planned this trip to visit some lesser known destinations as well as some better-known ones. We want to show that it can be done at our age (she’s 70, I’m 67), and that you can go by yourself, without a group, picking your own destinations, balancing serendipity with planning, and keeping the freedom to  explore with maximum contact with local people.

  With both my wonderful Canon 5D Mark III full-frame digital SLR and the Noblex Panoramic (film) camera, I’ll be photographing spectacular geology and landscapes, flora and fauna, and above all the people we encounter: “environmental” portraits (in the context of their lives), where they live, shop, and conduct their spiritual and recreational lives. Plus, I’ll be interviewing many of them with the 5D Mark III and an external microphone, asking about the changes they’ve seen in their lifetimes, the problems they foresee in climate change, agriculture, water management, the role of global corporations, and how they view the Unite States. I’ve always made lots of friends when I traveled, and we will certainly be good-will ambassadors for the US, showing people that we thought it was worth it to visit them, and that we’re interested in their problems and perspectives.

  In 70 days from March 31 to June 10, of this year we plan to visit the following:

  •TURKEY: Cappadocia, including dawn hot air balloon ride, Istanbul

  •JORDAN: Petra, Wadi Rum, Shobak and Karak Crusader castles

  •KENYA: Nairobi wildlife park and city

  •MADAGASCAR: Isalo and Ranomafana National Parks, plus the cities of Antsirabe and Fianarantsoa

  •INDIA: the Ghats of Varanasi on the Ganges, the erotic temples of Khajuraho, and Panna wildlife park

  •NEPAL Kathmandu, villages, Himalayas, culture

  •TIBET: Llahsa, the Buddhist temples and mountain terrain

  •CHINA: Beijing, Great Wall

  •MONGOLIA: yurts, Gobi Desert (locus of dinosaur fossils), falconers

  •VIETNAM: Ho-Chi-Minh City, overland the length of the country, ending in Hanoi and Ha Long Bay

  •CAMBODIA Angkor Wat

  •JAPAN: Osaka and Kyoto

  Although we won’t be traveling de luxe, the trip has considerable expenses, and I intend to produce a photography book of the best images, my own tribute to Richard Halliburton’s 1938 Book of Marvels which gave me the travel bug when I was a teenager: Marvels 2014. I’ll be keeping a blog as we go, and I’m eager to share it with anyone who wants to come along as our virtual companion. I also plan to be tweeting as we go, with photos. So follow me on the blog: marvels2014.blogspot.com

And follow my tweets at @jssphoto

And if you can help us out with expenses at the level of $30, I’d love to send you the DVD of the interviews I collect, that will also contain at least 200 of my best images in low-resolution, suitable for onscreen viewing. For a larger contribution I’ll send you a signed, limited edition print, either on paper or on aluminum, as you can see in my video. The complete schedule of perks is on the right of the video.

 If we reach our entire goal of $10,000, I will publish the photo book, Marvels 2014, and include it in every contribution of $450 and over, and make it available for $50 to everyone else. It will be at least 100 pages long and contain texts based on the blog and more.

  We hope that this jouney will inspire others to see the marvels of our world for themselves and to meet people on their own terms to see what problems they face, and how they solve the universal challenges of life on this earth differently, maybe even better in some cases, than we do. The world has grown smaller since Halliburton traveled by ship, plane, camel, donkey, rowboat and by foot to visit the places he went, but now more people can go. We’ll show you how you can do it. So if this appeals to you, at the very least subscribe to my blog and spread the word. You can do it through the Indiegogo share tools.

  See you en route!

story:
The NYDC Capitalists is an IQA official community team with branches located in New York, N.Y. and Washington D.C. The brainchild of four former university captains, NYDC has a highly competitive roster composed of quidditch notables and medaled athletes from the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic regions. 

In November 2013, NYDC was one of 80 teams to qualify for World Cup VII, the event of the season. The catch is, it is in North Myrtle Beach, S.C., which is quite the trek from our cities. That is where you come in!

We would greatly appreciate it if you would donate to our campaign and distribute the link to this page! Your donations will go directly toward reimbursing the Capitalists for their WCVII travel expenses.

Thank you in advance for your assistance in helping us get one step closer to our dream of taking home the Cup!

What is Quidditch?

Muggle Quidditch, a co-ed, full-contact sport, has grown from a game started by Middlebury College students in 2005 to an internationally recognized sport with more than 500 teams in existence. The International Quidditch Association (IQA) now holds an annual Quidditch World Cup where teams compete for the title of IQA World Cup Champion.

Find out more: http://iqaquidditch.com/

Meet the Capitalists

Here is a list of every player on our team and what team they played for prior to NYDC. You will see 21 of these names on our World Cup VII roster:

Follow us on social media:
https://www.facebook.com/NYDCcapitalists, https://twitter.com/NYDCCapitalists

Where do the dollars go?

We are composed of teachers and college students, assistants and designers, among other odd jobs. Most of us do not bring home a large paycheck and this trip is an expensive undertaking. Here’s what your donations will help us purchase:

- Transportation for 21 players--planes, trains and automobiles.
- World Cup VII registration: $400
- Hotel rooms so we do not have to sleep in our cars: $2,604

Spread the Magic

1.  Contribute - look over the perks and contribute at a level that works for you.
2.  Pass on the campaign information so others have the opportunity to help us spread the word. 
- Please use the "Share this Campaign" tool at the top of this page.
- Re-post my Indiegogo link on your Facebook and Twitter pages: igg.me/at/NYDCQuidditch

Shoot us an e-mail at NYDCCapitalists@gmail.com if you have any questions and we’ll get back to you as soon as we possibly can.

story:
Beasley Skateboard Park is a Canadian Skateboard Heritage site. Since the late seventies or early eighties skateboarders have shredded the Beasley Bowl in downtown Hamilton, Ontario, Canada. The smoothly inclined bowl was originally designed as a summer wading pool for kids, but was perfect for skateboarders as well. In 1991 the city of Hamilton decided to build a small skateboard park around the Beasley bowl, and since 1992 the local skateboarders have had Ontario's longest running annual skateboard contest at Beasley Park. For the 10th annual contest, we formed the Hamilton Skateboard Assembly in order to give a voice to the skateboarders of Hamilton. This year we will be holding the 20th annual Hamilton Sk8 Jam at Beasley Park

The concrete surface at Beasley Park, poured in the early 1990's, is in a sad state of disrepair and needs to be replaced. Over the last twenty years, large cracks and frost heaves have made the concrete rough and all but unskateable. The city has contributed a new grind rail and a couple of jersey barriers to the park, but really needs financial help to give the park the new surface it needs and deserves.

The City of Hamilton has slated a resurfacing for the park, possibly, in 2016. Our goal is to make sure this happens, and to make it happen SOONER rather than later.

Currently, The Hamilton Skateboard Assembly, in conjuction with the Beasley Neighbourhood Association and the City of Hamilton’s Adopt-A-Park program have set up The Beasley Skatepark Development Fund to help speed up the process and assist the city on a financial level.

Your donations here will go to the Beasley Skateboard Park Development Fund. This fund will be used to offset the city's costs for the resurfacing and help ensure the project goes forward ahead of the current 2016 date. The city will have no reason to delay once the funding is secured for Beasley. We have the full support of the City Councilman for our ward, the city's Adopt-A-Park program and the Beasley Neighbourhood Association, who are our partners in caring for Beasley Park through the city's Adopt-A-Park program.

Thank you for your support!

Derek "Oldschool" Lapierre
HSA Chairman of the Board

story:
Your New Favorite Outdoor Tracker

Create a tracking grid with your friends' mobile phones via bluetooth or go it alone
with location sharing.

Trekking safely has never been so affordable. Find your stuff. Find your friends. 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

So Nothing Important Goes Missing

 

 

 

If you trek out where there is no coverage, no problem! Track your items or crew with bluetooth. Outdoor activities shouldn’t be limited to cell coverage.

 

Grant temporary access to your device from the app before you head out. Now, others to track your location if necessary.

 

Flashing ultra-bright LED lights and a loudly-repeating sound beacon locate what matters in seconds with bluetooth.

 

 

 

Wind, rain, cold - doesn’t matter. Breadcrumb is built to last and stands
up in even the most extreme conditions.

 

 

Trek confidently knowing you’ll get up to 6 months of battery life
on just two user replaceable AAA Lithium batteries.

 

 

 

Reliable tracking shouldn't cost you hundreds of dollars in monthly fees or
force you to regularly buy new units. Breadcrumb is incredibly affordable, ensuring you're able to put one in the hands of everyone you're with.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Setting up your new Breadcrumb Safety Beacon is quick and easy.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are able to ship worldwide. VAT and GST not included. Please see reward for details on the shipping cost that applies to you.

 

We plan to ship US orders in time for Christmas Delivery. Breadcrumb’s Safety Beacon is
the perfect holiday gift or stocking stuffer! We will keep you up to date on our progress and the expected delivery date for your order. Actual ship dates may vary. We will keep you notified of your product ship date.

 

By backing now, you’ll get to own one of the very first products off of the line, plus exclusive access to provide valuable feedback that will shape future generations of the product.

       So Nothing Important Goes Missing   If you trek out where there is no coverage, no problem! Track your items or crew with bluetooth. Outdoor activities shouldn’t be limited to cell coverage. Grant temporary access to your device from the app before you head out. Now, others to track your location if necessary. Flashing ultra-bright LED lights and a loudly-repeating sound beacon locate what matters in seconds with bluetooth.   Wind, rain, cold - doesn’t matter. Breadcrumb is built to last and standsup in even the most extreme conditions.  Trek confidently knowing you’ll get up to 6 months of battery lifeon just two user replaceable AAA Lithium batteries.   Reliable tracking shouldn't cost you hundreds of dollars in monthly fees orforce you to regularly buy new units. story:
The Messenger Bag - Re-invented

It's been 2 years since we launched our first product - 7ven Messenger. Since then, we've listened to our community for ways to improve this versatile bag. Today, we're proud to introduce a lighter, slimmer version of this pack: 7ven Mini.

The 7ven Mini combines the professionalism of a briefcase, the space of a duffel and the efficiency of a messenger bag, providing endless versatility.

 

 

One Bag For Every Day

Most bags are either all work and no play OR all play but no work. We think that a healthy balance (as all things in life) is the ideal scenario for a bag. So we combined elements to make this bag look sleek and professional but not too serious that it becomes boring. You'll be able to seamlessly transition from the boardroom to more casual scenarios like the gym or just hanging out with friends.

Its unique triangular shape and use of high-end materials mean the 7ven Mini is equipped to handle all of your daily needs. 

  • It stands without tipping over.
  • The front flap is adjustable, so the bag can expand to carry as little or as much as you need.
  • It has durable, high-end carry handle and a strap management system to help you stay professional when you need to.  

 

 

 

 

REVIEWS

 

 

 

 

Perks & Pricing

As we've done with all of our campaigns, we want to pass on the saving to you. We want to thank you by giving you access to our new products first, at a heavily discounted price. We are offering you the 7ven Mini at wholesale price, as we are producing these bags ourselves and selling exclusively online for the time being. This means there are no middlemen or retailers taking a profit from this sale. This way, the savings are directly transferred to you.

 

Please Share This Project

Know someone who will love this project?

Let them know about it by clicking on the buttons below:

If you're interested in writing about this project, you can find everything you need in our Press Kit

 

WE ARE ALPAKA

Our gear is built for the city but is tough enough to thrive in the outdoors. We're crowdfunded and damn proud of it. We exist because of you and with your support, we'll be able to continue to bring you awesome gear to help with your everyday and travel adventures.

 

This is our 5th crowdfunding campaign and we've delivered thousands of products around the world. There are few things we love more than when our backers share how they use our products in their daily lives. This is what drives us. 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

This is our fifth crowdfunding campaign in just over 2 years. The real challenge starts after the campaign ends and the funds are released. We know that with our experience we will be able to produce the bag and have it shipped to backers by April – 2019. We have the full support of the manufacturer and fulfilment has already been planned.

Even though we do not see any direct risks, there are always unforeseen circumstances that may present themselves during production and fulfilment. If this were to occur, we will always be 100% transparent with you and communicate this to you right away. Our goal is to get you an awesome, high-quality bag you are excited about, and we will do everything we possibly can to make that happen.

story:
Ready to go beyond adventure?

Select your 50 Liters modular backpack and connecting accessories to create your perfect travel bag.

50L MODULAR BACKPACK

To allow you to build your perfect backpack, Owly Packs designed it to be completely modular, with a slew of accessories and compartments to choose from.

To allow you to build your perfect backpack, Owly Packs designed it to be completely modular, with a slew of accessories and compartments to choose from.

 

 
Creating an adaptable traveling backpack able to respond to all your traveling needs is what inspired the creation of the Owly Packs modular backpack. From its modern look to its versatility, each element was carefully thought to optimize its efficiency while also respecting its stylish and uncluttered design.

- 34.5 to 55 Liters capacity

- Water repellent

- Highest quality zippers on the market

- Integrated water bottle holder

- Easy-to-access cellphone holder

- 3 secret compartments (can fit an iPad/laptop)

- H2O Pocket

 

 

 

Allow yourself to disconnect and escape to the stars! 

The Owly Packs tent-hammock will fit perfectly with the bottom compartment of your backpack!

This product was created with the goal of allowing adventurers to surpass their traveling limits. In perfect harmony with nature, it will allow you to disconnect and escape to the stars!

- Waterproof shelter

- Mosquito nets

- Easy color system guide, providing an easy and hassle-free assembly experience

- Three easy-access storage pockets

- Two large doors for a panoramic view of the outdoors

- Equipped with a simple mobile-pole system that creates a straight & comfortable laying down position 

This tent-hammock has enough space for 2, and your backpack of course!

Install it between two trees or on the ground.
 

 

Prepare yourself to share with others!

You can replace the bottom 15.5L section of your backpack with our cooler bag of the same size. This will allow you to keep your beverages and food cool during your expeditions, all while fitting perfectly to your Owly Packs backpack.  

- Connects to the bottom of the backpack

- Can hold up to 18 drink cans

- Easy to carry once detached from the backpack (thanks to its handle!)

 

No equipment will be left behind!

The straps fastening system is strategically placed on the bag and will allow you to hang any kind of accessories on the sides and the front of your backpack. Strap your sleeping bag, your yoga mat or even your longboard to the backpack and keep your hands free. You're welcome.

 

With versatility at the heart of every Owly Packs creation, these side bags are no exception! It will be a clever addition to your next adventure, both to hold your drinks at the beach or to shop at the night markets.  Add it to the side of the backpack for additional space. Store your second pair of shoes, toiletries or beers for the road!

 

We care about you, your projects, your travels, your adventures! Therefore, we will continue to innovate and create products with YOU in mind.

 

 

Tell us about how and why you are using your backpack and what kind of add-ons you would like to have ! Our research and development team are constantly on the lookout to improve our products.

 

 

 

The idea of Owly Packs emerged during a trip in Australia. Truth is: we were broke and thus forced to sleep in parks while waiting for our seasonal job to begin. With nothing but our backpack, we had no protection from the weather and would always wake up soaked from morning dew. We hoped that our backpack could magically transform into a shelter. As magic apparently would not do it, WE did. Since then, the concept has evolved tremendously. We went from a transformable backpack to an horrible brown tent and finally, after dozens of rounds of prototypes, to these fantastic products we are so proud to present you today!

CREATIVE PROCESS AND PRODUCTION

The initial idea was to create a backpack that could be transformed into a tent, a hammock and a sleeping bag. So, we bought an old sewing machine, then using tutorials to learn basic sewing, we managed to create a first functional prototype.

We did several tests on this product, which were convincing enough to take this project seriously.

In 2017, we contacted the Montreal Inventarium, a company specialized in intellectual property and commissioned an international patent search. They also took care of the creation of our technical drawings, and we applied and received a provisional patent to protect our idea in order to develop our products in complete peace of mind. Then, we created the Owly Packs company, and started investing countless hours in research and development.

It's in 2019 that we finally got our 100% finished products. We did all sorts of tests to confirm their quality, versatility and durability, and after more than two and a half years of work, we finally went into brand creation and marketing. 

They talked about us:

Risks & Challenges

The different stages of the maritime import of merchandise remain a major challenge. Through quality control, freight forwarding, customs brokerage and warehousing, every detail will need to be carefully considered. To do so, our team will travel to Vietnam to personally take care of the quality control. We also commissioned two renowned Montreal companies for the forwarding and brokerage portion to take care of our goods.

Each challenge remains an opportunity to acquire new knowledge in our field and allows us to improve each of the entrepreneurial skills that the creation and development of a company requires. We face it with enthusiasm and see these challenges as the steps to take to take our business to the next level.

Terms and conditions

Since we are shipping in many countries around the world, we can't pay taxes and customs fees for everyone. It means you will have to pay various freight and duties or taxes according to your country, including VAT and GST Taxes.

You can use that tool to calculate duties. Don't forget to convert U.S. dollars to your local currency: http://www.simplyduty.com/import-calculator/

International customers who are required to pay customs will receive an email from their local authorities asking for payment to have your order processed through customs. Once the payment is done, your order will be processed for final delivery.

International taxes are out of our control, but we are going to make sure to assist you during this process if you need any help from us. Please contact us on private message if you have any question about that.

story:
At mafazon, we have made it our mission to develop the world's first foldable cooling device that you can wear around your neck, freeing your hands in a way that other portable cooling devices don't. We have brought our product to a few pilot testers and they are mindblown how our device could help to transform their sweaty and sticky summer to a cool (literally and figuratively) play season.This is a stylish, high-tech piece of wearable tech that offers you all the safety and convenience that you could ever want out of something so convenient!
 
 

N-fan is very simple to use, only hold the button in the back side for 3 sec and you can enjoy the medium wind speed, press again you can change to high speed level and press 1 more time you can enjoy the strongest wind with turbo speed.  The N-Fan of the air outlet can rotate up to 200 degrees, while both side motors can rotate up to 360 degrees.

The pure copper motor in n-fan is no louder than a normal breeze, just 15-25 decibel  similar level to the sounds of whispering. This means that you never need to worry about bothering yourself or others with noise from our cooling device. similar level to the sounds of whispering

Set N-Fan to whatever fan speed you prefer: medium, high, or turbo. This is about your comfort  nothing else – and you are in charge, making moment-to-moment decisions regarding what it is going to take to put you at ease and help you slip into total relaxation.

Requiring no extra batteries, N-Fan runs on a 2600 mAh lithium battery

Power Source: Micro USB

Charging time: 4.5 hours

Using time:

Medium Speed: Lasts 7.5 hours

High Speed: Lasts 5 hours

Turbo Speed: Lasts 4 hours

N-Fan is the world's first foldable cooling device that you can wear around your neck, freeing your hands in a way that other portable cooling devices don't. This is a stylish, high-tech piece of wearable tech that offers you all the safety and convenience that you could ever want out of something so convenient and trendy. 

This is a leap forward for wearable tech, taking a great concept and transforming it into something fashionable – something cool (in more ways than one!). Fashionable, durable, lightweight, and powerful, N-Fan is the only cooling device you are going to need wherever you go, from the office to the safari and every bus, plane, and train in between.

Wherever you go and whatever you are doing, you should be able to assume that it's going to be comfortable. This hasn't been the case until now, though. N-Fan puts you in control of your body temperature. We have tested the effectiveness of n-fan and found that it cools you off 7°C in 3 minutes.

You can wear N-Fan all day long, using it from the moment that you step into your kitchen and cook breakfast to the hours that you spend in your office to the restaurant where you go out for dinner. Outdoor events, sport outings, concerts, festivals, fishing trips, long car rides, oceanic cruises, classrooms – anywhere at all, N-Fan is there to cool you down.

We want you heading out in style so we have 2 colours available for you fans out there. First, we have a jet black version which should prove versatile for any fashion pieces you are wearing. Next, we have a sky blue version suitable for folks that love more bright colours. Whatever you fancy, these two colours should satisfy you. For each pack we will offer a micro USB cable and a mafazon case. 

We have brought our product to a few pilot testers and they are mindblown how our device could help to transform their sweaty and sticky summer to a cool (literally and figuratively) play season.

Before N-Fan, the only solution you had to keep cool outdoor is outdated, ugly, bulky and inconvenient. 

What's wrong with the old solution? I am sure you know better I do. Given that it is a hand-held device, it is convenient for you when you are outdoors. The small motor also make any cooling effect negligible. Worse of all, who wants to carry around such an uncool device? 

The whole team at mafazon shares a singular goal: to design innovative products that make life easier. N-Fan represents a concerted effort to make life easier by making it more comfortable and put a high-quality cooling device within your reach everywhere you go.

Our goal through this campaign is to raise $50,000 in start-up capital to cover the costs of manufacturing, marketing, and distributing n-fan on a large scale. We will use any funds that we raise over our $50,000 goal to expand our marketing campaign, bringing n-fan to an audience all around the world. To show our appreciation for all your generous contributions, we are offering n-fan at a significant discount exclusively through this campaign. 

N-Fan is something that our team have spent countless days (and nights) designing. A fan is a century old device, but how could we redesign it such that it offers convenience, and effectiveness. To offer such an experience, we have to redesign the whole fan from scratch - from the motors to moulding, every single component has to be redesigned to fit this device that you see today. 

Specifically we achieved a few breakthrough:
- Size and weight: only 190 x 110 x 20mn when folder, 210g, this is definitely one of the most portable fan you will ever find. In fact when you wear it, you will barely notice it is there
- Motor power: 2w*2 copper motor to ensure it is small but packs strong power to deliver cooling wind
- Battery type: 2600mAh so that you could last the day outdoor. Depending on the speed mode used, n-fan can last a minimum of 4 hours and up to 7.5 hours on full charge

Conceiving the idea for n-fan in July 2017, we completed the six-month development process on our first prototype in July 2018. Prototyping and testing continued for the ten months, leading up to our campaign launch in August 2019.Our estimated shipping time is on September 2019.

Beyond making a monetary contribution to our campaign, you can help out mafazon and our efforts to bring N-Fan to market by sharing a link to our campaign on Facebook, Instagram  and any other social media platforms you use. Spread the word far and wide about everything that we are doing to making cooling more convenient and fashionable than it has ever been before!

We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing.

In fact when you wear it, you will barely notice it is there- Motor power: 2w*2 copper motor to ensure it is small but packs strong power to deliver cooling wind- Battery type: 2600mAh so that you could last the day outdoor. Depending on the speed mode used, n-fan can last a minimum of 4 hours and up to 7.5 hours on full chargeConceiving the idea for n-fan in July 2017, we completed the six-month development process on our first prototype in July 2018. Prototyping and testing continued for the ten months, leading up to our campaign launch in August 2019.Our estimated shipping time is on September 2019.Beyond making a monetary contribution to our campaign, you can help out mafazon and our efforts to bring N-Fan to market by sharing a link to our campaign on Facebook, Instagram  and any other social media platforms you use. Spread the word far and wide about everything that we are doing to making cooling more convenient and fashionable than it has ever been before!We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing.

story:
"The Upside Rack is very innovative. It's a unique solution to haul any bike on any vehicle with roof bars" - Bike Radar

"Sean and Stefan have combined brilliantly to take a fresh look at how we transport our bikes. When we met them it was clear that they had come up with a practical and ingenious solution that we can't wait to get our hands on" - La Velocita

"An innovative system that allows you to mount almost any bike on any rack. Eliminates the need to use different carriers for different bikes" - New Atlas

​

Flexible - Road bikes, mountain bikes, fat bikes, kids bikes. This rack has all your options covered. 

Portable - Ride whenever, wherever. It's compact, transferable across cars in seconds and is only on when you need it. 

Quality - Designed and crafted for high strength and soft touch, all tested beyond the highest standards. 

Soft Grip - The Upside Rack doesn't touch your frame. It gently secures your bike via the seat and handlebar.

Fast - On and off in seconds. Only one clamp to tighten the whole Upside system

 

 

 

 

 

​

Size - 610mm x 140mm x 140mm

Weight - 1.8kg

Bike Capacity - 17kg 

Certifications* - ISO/PAS 11154:2006(E), includes City Crash norm

Fits Roof Racks - Outer edges 550mm - 930mm, cross-rail thickness under 35mm 

*These are expected production outcomes & targets. Slight changes are possible in order to achieve high volume production. Certification requires official testing by accredited facilities using production components.

 

Trails, roads, mountains and even slow rides with our kids. We spend more on our bikes than we do on our cars. When it comes to bikes, there's a solution for almost every rider and ride. Tyres range from the width of your finger, to the width of your face. Frames are all sorts of shapes and lightweight carbon lay-ups are not designed to be clamped. Securing you bike for the adventure is getting harder and harder. Over a year ago, we set ourselves a mission, to get our bike to the trailhead regardless of which bike we choose. We went back to first principles of design, back to the drawing board to search for a secure, fast and gentle solution. We wanted less hassle, more riding... and we did it!!

Stefan & Sean started this mission with a fantastic complement of skills and quickly enlisted/recruited some truly amazing people who have taken this project to another level. Collectively we have designed and implemented for Bentley, Audi, Jaguar, Mercedes, BMW, Volkswagen, Chevrolet, Buik, Holden, ARB, Nissan, Toyota, Vauxhall, Yarra Trams, NS Bikes and Antidote Bikes. In addition, we have delivered more than $1.1 billion dollars in capital and operational projects over the past decade for organisations such as Public Transport Victoria, Transdev, MTR, KD, Defence Materiel Organisation and Siemens.

Sean is passionate about all things on two wheels. His obsession with bikes is matched only by his love of challenging assumptions. 

Stefan believes anything is possible with the right team, passion and mindset. His preoccupation with product perfection is never ending. 

Waldek is an aerospace engineer with a passion for cars and mountain biking. His engineering team of 30 people serve the likes of BMW, Audi and Volkswagen. His favourite saying is "Impossible tasks right away. For miracles, you have to wait one day". 

Igor is a bike-nut, off-roading enthusiast & problem solver. He's most at home with an ultra-powerful laptop, 4WD and a mountaintop for an office. No technical problem, workshop or late-night CAD session scares him. 

Jurek is a mountain bike freak, designer and co-owner of Antidote Bikes. Designing and riding are the most important things in his life. 

Troy has 25 years in the bike industry and an extreme passion for anything off-road. Attention to detail, loyalty and accountability in life and work are his trademarks.

A massive thank-you to the awesome people that helped us along this journey, answering a thousand questions and always with a smile.

Find us at any of the following:

  • Our Website
  • Facebook
  • Instagram
  • Youtube
  • Vimeo
  • email: questions@upsideracks.com

 

FAQs

Can I fit more than 1 bike?

Absolutely, you can fit 2-5 if you 'head to tail' them. How many depends on the width of your roof bars, width of your handlebars and if the roof bars extend out beyond the mounting brackets. So with road bikes (narrow handlebars) on a wide rack you could fit 6 (using the three cross rails like Sean's white Landcruiser in the GIF). On a small car with mountain bikes (wide handlebars) you may be limited to two.

Does it lock?

It does now.... we have worked really hard to create a solution we can be proud of. An electronic lock has been included in ALL versions of the rack. Check out the updates sections for some insider info on the lock mechanism and how it all happened.

Is it a problem to have my suspension forks upside down? 

Having your suspension forks upside down is actually a good thing. It keeps the internal components like the foam rings and wiper seals lubricated. This helps to cut down on static friction (stiction) in use. When oil seals and foam wipers dry out they drastically increase friction inside the fork. Depending on the lower leg bath oil levels and service intervals, just riding and compressing the fork may not provide the optimal lubrication for the seals. 
It is for this reason that some suspension manufacturers and professional riders recommend storing your bike upside down. 
You'll have no problem with leaks unless you have a seal failure already. Compressing the fork on uneven trail surfaces as you ride produces far more pressure on the seals than turning the bike upside down. Many forks (like the current most popular fork on the market) have no air inside the damping system. 
They use a closed system with a bladder to compensate for temperature and variations like some hydraulic brake systems. In this case the position of the system makes no difference to its function.

Will turning my bike upside down get air in the my hydraulic brakes?

Correctly bled and operational hydraulic brakes have NO air inside the system. Air is present only in the bladder behind a rubber membrane in the lever. It is designed so that air cannot escape the bladder and enter the system even if upside down. 
Its function is to compensate for variations in temperature since fluid slightly expands when its temperature increases. It also allows for the change in volume of the fluid system as brake pads wear. 
Before riding, brakes should always be tested whether the bike has been upside down or not. If your brakes are not fully operational, there is an issue in the system and the brakes should be serviced. 
Check out the following link for a great explanation of how a hydraulic brake system works:
http://www.epicbleedsolutions.com/blog/how-hydraulic-brakes-work/

Won't spinning wheels wear out my bearings?

Wheel bearing wear is generally a result of both cycles and load combined. The wear rate increases dramatically with load. There is a detailed equation in the link below calculating the life of the wheel bearing based on these inputs. But more simply put, the key things to know about spinning wheels in transport are as follows: 
- Doubling the load on the wheel bearing reduces the life to one tenth. Reducing the load by half increases the life by ten. 
- Doubling spin speed reduces wheel bearing life by one half. Reducing speed by one half doubles the life. 
- When the load reduces to zero, wheel bearing life extends to infinity.

Ok, we know a wheel doesn’t weigh zero. But compared to a bike and rider, the load and 
therefore wear on a wheel bearing while spinning in transport is negligible. 
We have carried out some initial test runs at 100km/hr and the wheel spin is negligible compared to wind force whilst the vehicle is stationary, there is some science saying the windforce on top an bottom of the wheel would prevent any crazy spin speeds. We are definitely going to test further and will offer a simple strap to secure it, if it proves to be an issue.

If you're interested in the math, here is an excellent site for further details: 
http://www.nmbtc.com/bearings/engineering/load-life/

Will it put too much stress on my seat-post / seat rails / handlebars / headstem?

We deliberately take advantage of bicycle design (including carbon and alloy material characteristics) to provide a strong, secure and gentle grip of your bike.

The design of the rack ensures the load on the seat is up/down, which is the same as when ridden. There is no twisting load on the seat post as the handlebars take that load which is also the same as when riding. Clearly the weight of the bike is considerably less than the lightest rider, so if it is ok for the ride it will definitely be ok for the Upside Rack.

When it comes to testing for stresses and any vibration impacts, we are relentless. We have a grueling test plan to complete, testing for durability of the rack and protection of your bike.

Will it effect my dropper post?

The design of the rack ensures the load on the seat post is up/down, which is the same as when ridden. There is no twisting load on the seat post from the installed position, so any loads would be exactly what seat posts are designed to take in use. 
Regarding dropper posts, the load of the actual bike on the post will obviously be significantly less than a rider. 
We drop our posts before installation as well, but it's not necessary. We have tested on our dropper posts (Sean's is the Norco in the vids, Stefan's is the Stumpjumper) without any issues but have a plan in place to purchase the major models and test them further.

Testing .... what is environmental testing, and why do it?

The environment we live and ride in is harsh. Salts, ultraviolet light and other weathering impacts damage materials during their life. These impacts can be rapidly accelerated in laboratory conditions to understand lifelong impacts in normal use. 
The Upside Rack has been carefully designed using long-lasting and weather resistant materials such as anodized aluminium, which provide years of reliable use while maintaining the appearance you expect from a top-quality brand.

Testing .... what is vibration and rough road exposure testing, and why do it?

We come from the land of long, rough, harsh corrugated roads that seem to disappear over the horizon. So we know more than a little about durability and brutal, rugged roads in both professional and recreational capacities. 
So, when it came to producing the Upside Rack we combined our experience with the benefit of real world testing. The end result is an extensive test plan in place for the prototypes and first production units. This means that by the time you get your own Upside Rack, we will have tested it for more miles on rougher roads than you ever will.

Static testing, what and why?

Testing went well beyond seeing what it takes to 'rattle' the Upside Rack. We have analysed every joint, component and operation for any sharp edges, pinch points, squeaks and rattles to make sure you have nothing but an enjoyable experience getting to, and from your ride. That’s our goal. A rack that’s intuitive, unobtrusive and always reliable.

The City crash test and other load tests.... what and why?

Put simply, they ensure safety in the event you have to brake or swerve suddenly, to ensure the bike doesn't simply 'fly off the roof'. Our prototype has passed testing exceeding these conditions, testing will be replicated on the production unit to ensure certification is achieved before the first unit is sent out.

City Crash Test 
This is an international standard as part of ISO 11154 for roof load carriers on vehicles. It involves simulating a low-speed crash in which the rack with a bike installed is exposed to eight times its weight (commonly known as 8g). 
The rack passes this test if the bike remains fixed to the rack and car, and no part weighing more than 10 grams comes loose off the rack. This same standard applies to roof bars to ensure they don’t move under crash conditions so we recommend use of only ISO approved roof bars.

Other load tests 
Additional parts of ISO 11154 include pushing, pulling and lifting the bike as it is fixed to the rack and measuring any movement to ensure a secure fit. Forces of over 60kg are applied to simulate hard braking, braking while cornering, side wind load and aerodynamic lifting affects.

story:
It was June 9, 2007 that Rob and I finally said I do in front of family and friends. We've been together happily since 2001, so we recently celebrated 15 years of our relationship (which is quite the feat nowadays in and of itself). 
FUN FACT:  The song playing in the video just happens to be appropriate..  it was the song that played at our wedding in Vegas. 


It was only recently that we realized... wait, we never had a honeymoon! When we first got hitched in 2006, it was in front of the clerk of the court, then we went back to our household duties immediately after. When we finally had our  ACTUAL wedding in 2007, it was in Vegas, but the day after the nuptials? We returned home and resumed our usual life (work and responsibility called). We never really thought much about it. 


As most of you know, we have raised some amazing kids. And while we've made attempts to save up for a trip for just ourselves, well, as John Lennon once said, "Life is what happens when you get busy making other plans."
We've accepted this pearl of wisdom. Just when we think we have enough, something happens with one (or a couple) of the kids (of course they always come first). We stopped traveling for conventions (most of which the kids come with us, and let's face it, those aren't vacations), so we'd have more money to do things. Then emergency home repairs swooped in. Then my health began to decline, so yay medical bills. This isn't a sob story, it's just life. We've accepted that's how things are, and we accept it as is. Adulting always comes first, and that's just fine.

Most of you know just how hard we both work to provide our family with a more comfortable childhood and adolescence than we had, and personally?  I have watched Rob sacrifice a number of things to make sure that happens. And, as most of you know, Rob is far more supermegaresponsible than one man should ever  be. He's much more of the "adult" than I am in that fashion. I want to do this for him, especially. 

There have been a number of factors recently that made us stop and think, "You know, MAYBE,  just maybe, after 16 years, we'd get our first trip alone together, just to focus on us, and live a little... wouldn't that be cool?" 


So,  what the hell... life is short, so we're giving it a shot. With the research help of some close friends (and my wonderful oldest daughter), we're budgeting a trip to my motherland. Most of you know I was adopted, and my great-grandparents both come from St Lucia. We figured it would be more feasible to spend time IN Saint Lucia as opposed to spending most of the time on a cruise.

But, being the proud people Rob and I both are, we of course want to include all of our friends and family in this (we'd rather keep this amongst those who know us, as opposed to going public, so we hope you respect that). If you find it in your heart to contribute, we'd like to reward each and every one of you for your generosity. Check the perks, and anyone who contributes will be added to a secret Facebook group where you'll be privy to all of our plans and special deals and giveaways and such as our thanks to you for helping us to hopefully make this happen!

Of course, we'll keep you updated with plans and bookings and such as they happen. 

We'd love to spend our 10th wedding anniversary waking up to the beauty of Saint Lucia and each other, and hopefully you can help us make this a reality :)

story:
COME JOIN THE LIFE!

FIRST MILESTONE ACHIEVED! CAMPAIGN STILL ON. 

Jetzy is the world's first, geo-location based, social app that connects and rewards people who have passion for travel and unique experiences. 

Travelers and locals can explore location-specific, hidden-gems while making new friends from all over the world. In addition, posting photos, sending messages and bringing friends to Jetzy earns users JetPoints that give them free travel and other exciting rewards.

Jetzy is a network but what we are passionately fostering is a lifestyle: an attitude of global citizens to be innately curious about the world, endearingly inspiring for our community and infectiously supportive of living a life of purpose. That's what we call "Jetzy Life".

Check out our beta version of Jetzy app here. 

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/jetzy/id1019546379?mt=8

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.icreon.travelconnect&hl=en

 

 

 

 

How Was Jetzy Born?

Throughout their own travels, Jetzy co-founders Shama and Ty have been searching for a way to connect with like-minded people and share their adventures. 

 

 

 

 

Shama is a serial entrepreneur and a passionate traveler. Starting her career as one of the youngest female entrepreneurs in Pakistan, Shama has worked for Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley and has built several businesses in Technology, Fashion and Finance world.  But Shama has always been in pursuit of building something in travel space. Shama loves helping people and when she came up with the idea of Jetzy, she couldn't be more pleased because on Jetzy  people can enjoy their travel experiences, build meaningful connections and have unforgettable  experiences.

On the other hand, Ty, a veteran in the travel industry, always wanted to find a way to meet fellow explorers and locals while venturing to the edge of the world. Ty has spent a lifetime inspiring travelers to experience the world authentically, like a local, and always wanted to build something that the world has not seen before to help travelers achieve this dream on every journey.
 

 

A Brief Story of Jetzy

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Who Uses Jetzy?

 

 

What Can You Do with Jetzy?

 

Connect with people: Find and become friends with fellow travelers!

Instant travel advice: Need recommendations on spot? Shout out to people in the Jetzy community!

Discover hidden gems: Travelers can discover a city's hidden gems and have more immersive experiences by connecting with other nearby travelers, based upon your shared travel passions.

 

 

Create inspirations: Flashpackers can share their favorite restaurants and experiences through Shoutouts or even meet up with other travelers!

Earn free travel: Jetzy is world's first social travel app that offers rewards! By simply using the app, users earn JetPoints, which can be redeemed for everything from travel gadgets to amazing trips!

Make Friends: Through Jetzy, people truly embrace diversity by meeting other Flashpackers while exploring the hidden gems each city has to offer.

 

 

 

Overview of JetPoint Value

People LOVE Jetzy! 

 

Why Do We Need Your Help?

 

Right now we have an initial beta version of Jetzy and your contributions will help us launch the main version of the app and spread the Jetzy lifestyle around the world.  Our platform helps people embrace diversity by meeting both locals and fellow travelers while exploring. 

Contribute to Jetzy and let's bring the world together by sharing our passions!

We carefully prioritized our work to maximize our users' happiness, depending on the level of support we would receive from you.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Private Costa Rican island

 

Scholar-led walking tour (selected cities worldwide)

 

 

Luxurious Yoga B&B with private Yoga class on private beach in Mexico

 

 

Puerto Rico Rainforest

 

Escape to Myanmar

 

 

Polar bear encounter in Svalbard

 

 

Play with Sharks off Guadalupe Island, Mexico

 

F.A.Q.

Q: Am I a Flashpacker?

A: Are you social media addicted? Enjoy meeting new people? Hungry to travel like a local? If so, you ARE a Flashpacker – a trendy community that is the fastest growing segment in the travel industry. Welcome to the latest and greatest family of travelers!

Q: Do I have to be a frequent traveler to use Jetzy?

A: We love frequent travelers, of course. But we still love you if you are not a road warrior, because we love diversity, we know you’re always dreaming of your next adventure and we want EVERYBODY onboard!

Q: What are JetPoints?

A: JetPoints are reward points that can be obtained by simply using the Jetzy app. You can easily collect and redeem JetPoints for a wide range of rewards, from a solar phone charger to your dream trip to Tahiti! We are the ONLY app in the WORLD that offers FREE travel rewards. The more you chat, post images and share Jetzy, the more you get, the more free travel you qualify to do. Easy.

Q: How do I redeem my JetPoints for travel perks?

A: You will receive the JetPoints you earned through your contribution when you download the Jetzy app. You will have the option to keep the points for future use, or redeem them right away through an Indiegogo exclusive promo code, which will be sent by email. We highly recommend the latter as those perks are limited and much more valuable!

 

Q: What are EXTRA JetPoints mentioned in the perks?
A: Everybody gets 1,000 JetPoints for signing up on Jetzy; but you will receive EXTRA JetPoints when you contribute to our campaign and be able to use them immediately for cool free travel rewards!

story:
Features: 

✅Three separate hinging compartments to hold work, personal, and travel items
✅Retractable handle for wheeling and a soft handle for lifting
✅Sized for major airline carry on restrictions: 21.6 x 14.1 x 9 inch and 8.8lbs
✅TSA-approved combination locks
✅Patented design

Comes with the following optional accessories:

  • (1) Satchel Bag fitted for a 13” laptop and documents [attachable to luggage handle]
  • (1) Sorted Travel Case for chargers, passports, and other quick-access items
  • (1) Essentials Bag for toiletries and other travel necessities
  • (1) Active Fitness Bag for gym gear or shoes
  • (3) Packing Cubes to keep fresh and worn items separate
     

                                                                                                      

Travel Expert Approved

—

Barmes has been featured in the following publications since launch.


 


 

Introducing the first travel case with three separate hinging compartments.

—

Travel without stress. The unique design helps you always access essentials when you need them.
 


 

Every luggage comes with an option to include a set of high quality travel accessories in Leather or Fabric.

—



 

Features that make traveling simple.

—

Flexible spaces let you bring all of your essentials, and a unique portrait design means you can access them quickly and securely.





 

Rewards for early adopters.

—

Order now to get your hands on our flagship product's first and second production runs. Buy multiple pieces and save.
 

 

More than just a luggage.

—

Barmes is designed to make travel simple. Each piece includes the following accessories to help keep your belongings organized.


 

Harmonize your travel experience.

—

Whether you're traveling for a few days or up to a week, Barmes lets you be in control so you can create a travel system that works for you.
 

 

A luggage that optimizes for you.

—

Fit everything you need comfortably and maximize spaces to your preferences, so you can travel light without compromise.
 

 

Live. Work. Move.

—

We put people and movement at the heart of everything we do, offering complete flexibility to live, work and move.
 


 

Technical specifications.

—

 

You're always covered.

—

We stand by our products. Each Barmes purchase comes with a 5-year comprehensive warranty which protects against any and all product defects or damage that results in inoperability. Travel with peace of mind.


 

From the founder.

—


 

Follow us @BarmesDesign.

—
   
 

Download our media kit.

—

 

Explore our FAQ.

—

story:
A combination of skis and skates, that brings the thrill of skating to the slopes! Snowfeet attach right to your winter shoes or snowboard boots.  They fit into a  backpack, so you can take them anywhere.  Join us and get on board with the next big winter sport! 

 

 

 In order to buy one of these coloured models, choose a specific reward.

 

 

We’ve already delivered thousands of pairs to our customers around the world, and the positive feedback has been overwhelming!

 

 

 

 

Snowfeet are made of highly durable and lightweight fiberglass reinforced material. Metal ski edges enable easy stopping. Heel brake lets you slow down. Adjustable bindings let you attach Snowfeet to any shoe.

 

 

Use them for downhill on and off the slopes, in snowparks, through forest trails, and even for cross-country skiing.

 

 

Just attach Snowfeet to any winter shoes or snowboard boots with bindings. We recommend waterproof shoes with ankle support for protection.

 

One size fits all. We recommend Snowfeet for shoes of size: 5-13 US / 37-47 EU (men's).

 

 

So many people are excited about this new winter sport, it is going to take the world by storm. Some even assume it will be the next Olympic sport.

 

 

We’re ready to ship the first 2000 pairs to our supporters before the end of this winter! That way, you'll get to try Snowfeet this snow season!

Snowfeet are extremely light and small, so they fit into any bag and are easy to carry around. You don’t need ski boots or any other heavy and expensive equipment.

 

 

 

Compared to skis or snowboard with all the gear, Snowfeet is super inexpensive while keeping durability, aesthetically pleasing design and overall quality. Saving money has never been easier! 

 

 

Of course, Snowfeet are not perfect and we're not scared to admit that, because most of our customers are super delighted with their purchase anyway. Here are some downsides you should be aware of before you buy Snowfeet:

  • Do all ski resorts allow the use of Snowfeet on their slopes?

Snowfeet are a new winter sport and you might come across people who are skeptical of them. That might also happen in a ski resort. However, the base of Snowfeet is made of the exact same metal ski edges as all the other skis. Our experience is that if you act as if you were skiing with your traditional skis, no one will bother you. And if that happens anyway, argue that Snowfeet are safe and contain metal ski edges, which is the most common requirement of ski resorts. Most importantly don't forget to stay positive and friendly, which helps the most.

  • Is it hard to learn?

Learning to use Snowfeet is as hard as learning to ski. So it takes some time and you will definitely fall now and then, but that’s part of the fun? Don't forget that learning is effortless if you enjoy the ride. 

  • Can I use them in powder?

You can use Snowfeet on snow that is not deeper than +/- 20 cm. Snowfeet are best on ski slopes, snow parks, forest paths and off the slopes too, just not in deep powder. Of course, Snowfeet are best on a groomed snow.

  • Can I use them on very steep slopes?

Because of their size and weight, it might not be as easy to stop and turn with Snowfeet as it is with regular skis. However, it's not really difficult either. You can stop the same way that you stop with skis or skates. It's also called a hockey stop. Additionally, you can also slow down with a heel brake, like with inline skates. To help you stay safe, we don't recommend using Snowfeet on extremely steep slopes.    

 

 

Be careful! Chinese counterfeits of Snowfeet are being sold on the internet
by a group of criminals.

Some of them only take your money and don’t deliver the product. Buying counterfeits is dangerous and illegal. The material is very low-quality and the metal edges do not work. We’re doing everything we can to make these criminals stop the illegal activity. Please help us by reporting the counterfeits sellers on Amazon, eBay, Alibaba, Aliexpress and other platforms. We are still too small to defend ourselves alone. We highly appreciate your help!

 

 

 

Get special offers, free giveaways, and once-in-a-lifetime deals and follow us now!

 

 

 

What size should I use?

One size fits all, so don't worry. Although we don’t recommend Snowfeet for shoes smaller than 5 US / 37 EU, and larger than 13 US / 47 EU.

What shoes should I use?

Use any winter shoes or snowboard boots with bindings. We recommend waterproof shoes that fix your ankle firmly.

Is it hard to learn?

It is as hard as learning to ski. So it takes some time and you will definitely fall now and then, but that's the part of the fun :)

How do you stop?

You can stop the same way that you stop with skis or skates. It's also called a hockey stop. Additionally, you can also slow down with a heel brake, like with inline skates.

How much is shipping?

Depending on the country you are from, $19 - $49 / 1 Pair. 

USA = $19 / 1 Pair | EUROPE = $19-$25 / 1 Pair | CANADA = $25 | JAPAN = $25 | AUSTRALIA = $39 | REST OF THE WORLD = $29 - $49

What is your return policy?

We give you a 30 Day Money Back Guarantee, because we believe in our product. Beware that the product has to be unused and in an original state and the shipping cost is paid by the customer. If you already used Snowfeet and you are unsatisfied and want to return it, let us know, we can talk about it and offer you a partial refund :)


 

Terms and Conditions and Disclaimer

Some aspects of skiing and related activities are potentially dangerous. Any person using Snowfeet is personally responsible for learning a safe way to ski, assumes all risks and accepts complete responsibility for any and all damages and injuries of any kind, which may result from use of this product. Skiing involves the general risk of injury. It is necessary to follow the rules of safe skiing. Safety of a child skiing with Snowfeet is a responsibility of the supervising person.

Not for children under 7 years of age. There is a danger of injury when speed or direction mistake occurs. The product Snowfeet should be used on a sufficient layer of snow, on hills and terrains with no obstacles, under adult supervision. Beware of other people and obstacles while skiing. The child should use firm footwear, protective gloves, and a helmet. We do not recommend using Snowfeet on steep slopes. Always wear protective gear and helmet.

The Snowfeet product is made of plastic. Do not use the product if it is damaged. Do not expose the product to temperatures over 40 °C or under - 20 °C, as these temperatures can cause irreversible damage to the product. Keep the package of the product away from children, a danger of suffocation in case of pulling the package overhead.

You ought to exercise good judgment and common sense when using Snowfeet skis. Snowfeet s.r.o. is not liable for injuries or damages arising from the dangers and risks inherent in this sport. Your safety and the safety of others depend upon your cautious and careful use of your Snowfeet skis.

Designs showed in this video are either previous models or prototypes. The original version that you buy might be different from the prototype.

By purchasing you agree with these Terms and conditions and confirm you have read the Disclaimer.

story:
Highly capable and intuitive, GEOPRESS™ is packed with innovative features to maximize utility, versatility and performance, while not sacrificing form and function. The result is a purifier that delivers unprecedented, unrivaled results.

We take water safety very seriously and rigorous quality control and testing process is thorough, intensive, expensive and worth every dime. Each batch of purifier cartridges we make are thoroughly tested and meet or exceed United States Environmental Protection Agency's National Drinking Water Standards. GEOPRESS removes 99.99% of virus (e.g. Rotavirus, Norovirus, Hepatitis A), 99.9999% of bacteria (e.g. E coli, Salmonella, Dysentery), and 99.9% of protozoan cysts (e.g. Giardia, Cryptosporidium, Amoebae).

Essential tools you carry should look as good as they work. Our color lineup is inspired by locations, environments, and specific user tastes. Whether you like to lay low, or stand out, we designed a color palette that offers an attractive option for anyone.

Water makes for a slippery environment. That's why we equipped GEOPRESS with TopoGrip™ technology and strategically placed it on all heavy-use surfaces needing to be grasped. It's non-slip, tactile, durable and really grippy in the heat, cold and when wet.

The SimpleVent™ Spout Cap allows you to 'press and purify' water with the cap on. It keeps the spout clean, and protects clean water from the threat of cross-contamination (when near dirty water). During the purification process, simply twist the SimpleVent cap 1/2 turn to allow for air to escape.

The versatility and ease-of-use of GEOPRESS is ideal for international travel and outdoor adventures. The convenience, efficiency and complete effectiveness of Fill. Press. Drink.™ is unmatched by any other water purifier (or filter). Allows anyone, anywhere, to drink from hotel sinks, beachside taco stands, public bathrooms and spigots, as well as rivers and lakes. 

When we set out to design GEOPRESS, delivering on portability and convenience was integral and something we wouldn't compromise. It's perfectly sized at 24oz (710ml), and it's easy to pack, clip or carry. You'll be self-reliant, and just seconds away from making clean drinking water, anywhere.

For travelers, adventure junkies, survivalists, backpackers, hikers, campers, fly fishermen, survivalists, and anyone living in countries who have on-the-go lifestyles that demand hydration.

Sometimes drinking from a river can be scary, even after dirty water has been purified. With GEOPRESS, you can rest assured that you can drink freely, from any freshwater source. It will remove all waterborne pathogens, and deliver clean, great tasting purified drinking water.  

Virus is present in drinking water in virtually all developing countries. It's also wasteful and a burden on the planet to purchase water bottles for international adventure travel. With GEOPRESS, anyone can tap into the world’s water sources and safely drink from sketchy spigots, hotel sinks, murky rivers, wells or lakes.

Adventure travelers have gone from staring at a kettle (boiling h2o), to drinking nasty chemicals (tablets), to pumping plus adding uv light (complicated & slow), to sucking while squeezing (huh?). You're familiar with the tech – it's bulky, awkward, complicated, a time suck (no pun intended). Most travelers and adventurers don't bother, and they buy bottled water instead, because it's available and convenient. Especially those those who live, or travel to those 105+ developing countries where waterborne pathogens are found in their water sources. Sigh.

We set out to invent a better way. And during the process, we created GEOPRESS.

Better in every way, not just better than our Ultralight Purifier, but superior than anybody else’s purifier too. GRAYL set out to make the best adventure travel purifier in the world and we may just have succeeded. It's leaps and bounds better than anything we've ever created. Sized for adventure — it’s unrivaled in ease, speed, versatility and convenience. Above all else, it provides a user experience that’s second to none.

  • Meets or exceed the standards demanded by the United Sates Environmental Protection Agency's National Drinking Water Standards.
  • Meets NSF/ANSI Standards: 42+53
  • Removes: 99.99% of viruses (e.g. Rotavirus, Norovirus, Hepatitis A), 99.9999% of bacteria (e.g. E coli, Salmonella, Dysentery) and 99.9% of protozoan cysts (e.g. Giardia, Cryptosporidium, Amoebae)
  • Filters: particulates (e.g. microplastics, sediment, silt), many chemicals (e.g. chlorine, benzene, chloroform) and heavy metals (e.g. lead, arsenic, chromium)
  • Active Technology: Electroadsorption (ion exchange, ultra-powdered activated carbon and silver treated zeolites
  • Height: 10.4" (26.5 cm)
  • Diameter (at base): 3.4" (8.6 cm) 
  • Diameter (longest edge of cap): 5.6" (14.2 cm)
  • Weight: 15.9 oz (450 g)
  • Capacity: 24 oz (710 ml)
  • Fast Flow Rate: 8 seconds per 24oz (5 liters/minute)
  • Purifier Cartridge Lifespan: 350 presses (65 gal / 250L)
  • Purifier Cartridge Shelf Life: Stored under proper conditions, an unopened Purifier Cartridge has a shelf life of 10 years. After a cartridge has been used, it lasts at least 3 add'l years.
  • Durability: Drop tested 'full' with clean water at 10' and sent to independent lab and passed our stringent microbiological tests.
  • Antimicrobial: Yes
  • Chemical-free: Yes
  • Materials: Polypropylene #5, food-grade silicone, TPE, ABS food-grade plastic
  • BPA free materials: Yes
  • Warranty: GEOPRESS is accompanied by a ten (10) year warranty covering workmanship and materials.
  • Designed in USA 
  • Country of Origin: Purifier cartridge media made in USA, Geopress made in China.

 

We're a team of adventurers and world travelers, who have all experienced the pains getting sick during our travels to remote countries around the world. In 2013, we decided to do something about it by dedicating ourselves to building purifiers for the rigors of badass adventure travel and outdoor exploration. We’re a small team in the northwest competing with the big boys. We love every second of it, and we’re actively trying the change the world one GRAYL Purifier at a time.
story_txt:
Meet the fastest, most versatile water purifier in the world. No other portable purifier rivals the ease, speed, and versatility of the GRAYL® GEOPRESS. In only seconds, GEOPRESS makes 24oz of clean, purified drinking water – anywhere in the world! Designed for international travel, it provides complete protection by removing all waterborne pathogens (virus, bacteria, protozoan cysts) and filtering pesticides, chemicals, heavy metals, and even microplastics.
 
 Highly capable and intuitive, GEOPRESS™ is packed with innovative features to maximize utility, versatility and performance, while not sacrificing form and function. The result is a purifier that delivers unprecedented, unrivaled results.
 
 We take water safety very seriously and rigorous quality control and testing process is thorough, intensive, expensive and worth every dime. Each batch of purifier cartridges we make are thoroughly tested and meet or exceed United States Environmental Protection Agency's National Drinking Water Standards. GEOPRESS removes 99.99% of virus (e.g. Rotavirus, Norovirus, Hepatitis A), 99.9999% of bacteria (e.g. E coli, Salmonella, Dysentery), and 99.9% of protozoan cysts (e.g. Giardia, Cryptosporidium, Amoebae).
 

 
 Essential tools you carry should look as good as they work. Our color lineup is inspired by locations, environments, and specific user tastes. Whether you like to lay low, or stand out, we designed a color palette that offers an attractive option for anyone.

 
 Water makes for a slippery environment. That's why we equipped GEOPRESS with TopoGrip™ technology and strategically placed it on all heavy-use surfaces needing to be grasped. It's non-slip, tactile, durable and really grippy in the heat, cold and when wet.
 
 
 The SimpleVent™ Spout Cap allows you to 'press and purify' water with the cap on. It keeps the spout clean, and protects clean water from the threat of cross-contamination (when near dirty water). During the purification process, simply twist the SimpleVent cap 1/2 turn to allow for air to escape.
 

 
 
 
 The versatility and ease-of-use of GEOPRESS is ideal for international travel and outdoor adventures. The convenience, efficiency and complete effectiveness of Fill. Press. Drink.™ is unmatched by any other water purifier (or filter). Allows anyone, anywhere, to drink from hotel sinks, beachside taco stands, public bathrooms and spigots, as well as rivers and lakes.

story:
Short Summary

Hi I'm Elaine Hargreaves and I'm taking on the Clipper Round the World yacht race. I'm looking to raise money for some beers in port  :) The race consists of 8 legs and around 15 races ; the boats are dry so if we make it around, leg by leg, we will need some cold beers in port.


What We Need & What You Get

 

You will receive the satisfaction of following a unique and exciting race - living through the adventure and emotional rollercoaster and all that mother nature can throw at me and my team mates and the satisfaction of helping out our team and urging us on ! A team that drinks together; performs together !

 

The Impact

 

Huge risks and challenges ahead - im a novice so bring on the open oceans; unknown crew teams and skipper and let's perform not just survive :)

 

Risks & Challenges

 Huge .

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also give to raise money age uk -  https://www.justgiving.com/elaine-hargreaves4

story:
Relax easily and relax often. We designed the new TreePod Lounger & Cabana to be your ultimate hanging relaxation escape.  

With only one hanging point and diameters of 4, 5 or 6 feet, TreePod takes the evolution of the hammock to an entirely new level.  

Whether you’re planning a weekend trip to the mountains or looking to escape everyday life on your own back porch, our newest TreePods will give you the comfort of a luxurious bungalow, along with the phenomenal floating experience of a hammock.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Both the TreePod Lounger & Cabana will come with a fabric or mesh pod, hand strap, frames, quick link, hanging rope, guy-line and carry bag, so all you’ll need is one tree or durable structure.

 

 

The only true difference between the two is the material. With the Cabana’s mesh walls, you’ll get a 360-degree view, a breeze and more importantly, shade. With the Lounger’s canvas walls, you’ll get a private escape that's quiet, serene and can even be used as an individual work space.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

OF COURSE! TreePods are super portable, incredibly durable and pack down to the size of the average tent. It’s perfect for tossing into your trunk for a relaxing getaway.

 

 

 

There are several accessories to enhance your TreePod Lounger or Cabana experience.  Below is a brief description of each and there will be opportunity to add accessories to your pledge after the campaign ends.
 

 

 

 

We know some of you might not be able to support us with a pledge, but that’s not the only way you can help us bring TreePod to life! Help us spread the love by sharing our campaign with your friends and family on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and wherever else you can think of!  

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us bring this dream to life!
