Refer to the instruction manual included with the product for warranty details. We have completed design, prototypes, and testing of the LANTERN MG-600. Our beta users have been telling us that this is the best LANTERN Light yet. We have begun a limited production run, and are looking forward to getting this new light out into the world. OUR TEAMOur team is a small one, but we bring with us years of experience in developing top quality lighting products. This is not our first rodeo! Together we have launched several successful crowdfunded products, including our signature light LANTERN Black and the popular LANTERN EDC-V1. These products have gone on to sell in over 90 countries around the world, and are now core products in the LANTERN Gear family of lights. RISKS & CHALLENGESWe make some of the best portable lights on the market today.  Our first light, the LANTERN Black, was launched back in 2016 and continues to be a popular choice.We have a proven track record of delivering quality products and backing them up with an excellent warranty. We promise that with the LANTERN MG-600, we will carry on with this commitment to quality and value. Our experienced team of dedicated people have successfully created and brought several lights to market already. We are bringing all of this experience to our launch of LANTERN MG-600.We are continuing our partnership with our manufacturer; the same manufacturer we have worked with on many of our previous products. Design, tooling and moulds for the product are already complete, and the light has successfully gone through the testing phase. In addition, we have already done a small production run. The next and final stage is mass production.The only risk we anticipate remaining in this project relates to logistics. We will actively manage our incoming shipping and will be doing all fulfillment in house to limit our reliance on third parties. While there is the possibility for logistical delays, we will keep all backers up to date as to the progress. How Can You Help?By sharing this campaign with your social networks and anyone else you think can benefit from this product, you are helping a small business to grow. Even if you are not able to contribute to this campaign, helping us to get the word out is also a huge help. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this to your Facebook or Twitter feeds or just grab the campaign link to share with friends and family.

story:
The World, Your Way
Travel Better, You Deserve It

We are a group of wanderlust, young and passionate entrepreneurs looking to bring only the best local experiences - things to do, sights to see, dishes to try, cultures to understand - to travellers like yourself. We broke free from the mundane holiday routines and want to bring the amazing discoveries around the world to you.

All our travel experiences are recommended by locals living in each of these beautiful cities around the world. Travelling is about experiencing the good and the bad, understanding places and people, getting absorbed into a new world and to rediscover ourselves.


Your Travel DNA
Discover From Others Like You

You are a unique individual with your unique travel personality. We call it your "Travel DNA". Imagine visiting a city and seeing it from the perspective of someone like you, it's almost like you are a native of the city! See what they like, where they go and what they do - be inspired.


Your Mood Swings
Something Different Everyday

Some days, you wake up seeking adrenaline rushes, while others, you just want to enjoy the tranquil alone time after a crazy night. How would you figure out what to do based on your ever-changing moods using Tripadvisor and Lonely Planet? You'll waste time burning away minutes and hours of your precious trip!

We take this burden away from you so you'll never waste a moment of your trip again. When you're looking for a "Wild" time, a "Chill" getaway, a "Thrill"-ing, a "Value" buy or just want to "Indulge" in luxuries, there will always be something a local suggestion for you.


Connect With Those Who Inspire You
See the City with a Different Lens

Travels are better with friends. What's even better is the chance to speak with, or even meet up with a local with a similar Travel DNA as you (it's almost like meeting another you!) at your holiday destination - sharing with you the stories of unnamed streets, hidden alleys and graffiti walls unknown to the outside world. These moments of discovery are what we want to bring to you.


What's Next For Us
Travel Will Never Be The Same Again

We have completed the Alpha Version of our iPhone App. You may request for an Alpha/Private Beta access from our website at www.globehop.co. We will need your support to continue this vision. We will be building more features to connect you with locals, adding more travel destinations and making more local experiences available to you. Together, we can make travelling meaningful and special again. Say NO to boring travel agency packages, fake reviews on Tripadvisor and Lonely Planet, and start travelling better with us - you deserve it.

story:
Snugs on TV

Click here to see all the media buzz about Snugs.


the problem

Everyone knows how agonizing it is to hold that untouchably hot metal utensil handle, how frustrating it is to see that wooden handle with scorch marks and how ugly your melted plastic utensil handle looks because its been resting on the edge of the pan that has been on the stove for too long. Not to mention the melted plastic from spatula heads getting into your food! Also, does the spoon slipping into the serving dish sound familiar? How about those messy drips when you move your spoon from the pot to the spoon rest? Arghh.. 



the nifty solution

These problems are ubiquitous and have been existing in our kitchens for ages. Looking at these common problems, we conducted a survey and we were not at all surprised by the feedback. Every single person who took the survey faced the same exact problems and was eager for a solution. 

This is when we started drawing the picture of a simple yet elegant gadget in our mind, this one single solution, that will take care of all the above problems. After months of brain storming, mechanical and industrial design, several iterations of prototypes, feedback from trial groups and intense testing, we came up with an optimally engineered, aesthetically seductive and Patent Pending innovation – The Snug.


the final product

  • Small Snug fits thinner, narrower utensil handles
  • Large Snug fits broader, rounder utensil handles



how to use


various uses

1.  on metal utensils


2.  on plastic utensils

3.  on wooden utensils

4.  on serving spoons

5.  keep the lid open


snug fits almost all handle sizes in the market

  • Small Snug fits thinner, narrower utensil handles
  • Large Snug fits broader, rounder utensil handles


snug works on pot edges with or without lip



thermal image says it all


material construction

  • Food-grade silicone
  • FDA compliant
  • High temperature grade silicone. Heat resistant up to 570°F (or 300°C)
  • Dishwasher safe




wash in the dishwasher or by hand


snug design details


snug variety packs

Snug 3-Pack in Solid Colors

(2 Small, 1 Large)


Snug 6-Pack in Solid Colors

(3 Small, 3 Large)


Snug 6-Pack in Translucent Colors

(3 Small, 3 Large)



who we are

story:
About Me

Less than two years ago, I started the Love and London Youtube channel so that I could help visitors to London to have the trip of a lifetime here in my city. It's turned into even more than that, with a community of over 30,000 people that are my motivation to keep creating useful videos, email newsletters, and social media content every day.

In response to hundreds of questions from our community and over 600 responses to my recent viewer survey, it's time for me to finally create what you guys have asked for-- a one-stop-shop guide to London, of all of my local recommendations.

What's going to be in the guide?

If you think that this is going to similar to one of those guides you can find online for free, or can pick up at the bookstore, you'll be disappointed (in a good way).

This guide includes:

1. A mega-PDF with every single one of the recommendations that I give my own family and friends when they come to London-- my favourite places in London. This includes food spots for all budgets, a few of my favourite bars to sip a cocktail, and the things to do around the city that gives you more of a "local" experience. 

2. My irk with traditional travel guides is that they don't tell you how close a recommendation is to where you are at the moment. London is MASSIVE and you shouldn't be traveling 45+ minutes across the city every time you want to eat a good meal. So you'll get my Google Map with all of my recommendations pinpointed on it, so whenever you feel hungry or need something to do, you can pull out your phone and see what's closest to where you are at the moment, and get directions too.

3. Getting the guide also gives you membership to a private Love and London Facebook group, where you can connect with other future visitors to London, ask each other questions, and essentially be a part of a "London visitor support group".

Consistent updates

Another think that irks me about traditional guides is that you have to buy brand new ones every year in order to make sure you've got up-to-date information. Even if you find information online, you might not be able to tell how recently it was written.

So if you purchase my guide, you'll be sent an updated guide every six months. I'll ensure I'm only recommending things to you that are still open, that have up-to-date opening hours and information, and I'll also be adding all of the cool new spots I discovered over the last six months.

Why are we raising money?

I'm giving you the chance to pre-order the guide now, at the cheapest price it will EVER be. 

Doing a pre-order helps me to gauge interest in the guide, and also get some input from you, the people who will be using it, on what you'd like to see in it.

As long as we reach our pre-sale goal, the guide will be launched in July, and whoever pre-orders it will be the first to get it.

Don't worry, if we don't reach the goal, you'll get your money back :) 

Other ways you can help

Already been to London? You're welcome to pre-order the guide for your next trip (might as well get it while it's cheap!) but you can also show your support by sharing this with family and friends who plan to visit soon. I'm sure they'll appreciate the heads up on the good price ;)

Thank you SO much to my Love and London community who keep me motivated every day with your amazing comments, photos on Instagram, and appreciative emails. It makes doing all of this so worth it!

story:
OK, the book is out and is being distributed!

All those who want their copy, and missed the original campaign, get it here: http://amzn.com/1494484846

Let me add that I don't have full control over price on Amazon, the additional discounts are all Amazon's business :o)

If you received your copy of the book (or even just the PDF) and you like it, please leave some nice comments and reviews on the Amazon page - thanks!

IN OTHER GOOD NEWS, if you want large size prints, framed pictures and very nice looking canvas prints of the photos from the series Without People, please visit my gallery on Crated: https://crated.com/oleg.mastruko

Crated is beautifully organized art showroom and gallery, please, browse the gallery, like, comment, share the link, and buy some nice prints. For now it's just photos from the series Without People, in couple months I will start adding photographs from the series Expiations and others.

THANKS AGAIN FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

=============================================

Boing Boing:
http://boingboing.net/2014/02/26/crowdfunding-without-people-a.html

Atlas Obscura:
http://www.atlasobscura.com/articles/without-people-project

Smithsonian:
http://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/what-would-world-look-without-people-180949835/

STRETCH GOALS

*** stretch goals *** stretch goals *** stretch goals ***

OK so when a campaign reaches its goal waaaay before the deadline, meaning there is solid interest in the project, the nice thing to do is to offer a STRETCH goal, ie a new goal and new perks for EVERYONE. The stretch goal for this campaign is.... ta daaam....

10.000 USD

I will use funds for my NEXT book. IF I reach this goal, everyone, EVERY participant, the OLD and the new ones, will get following perk for free:

- Perk "The Next One" where you get FREE Digital Copy of my NEXT book - the one about religious temples, with the working title "Expiations".

I am not going to list this perk in the column to the right, with other perks, because IF I REACH the STRETCH goal the perk will be free for all supporters.

So, nothing groundbreaking so far, but I hope these are nice incentives for existing supporters to try to attract new ones, to try to reach the new stretch goal, and for those on the proverbial fence to decide to support the campaign. Thanks.

*** stretch goals *** stretch goals *** stretch goals ***

Video editing by: Dusko Korlat

Music: MOON - Paris, used with permission (thanks, man!) http://music.musicofthemoon.com


Without People

I am journalist and magazine editor from East Europe but what really makes me tick is photography. I travel a lot and make all sorts of photos, however I am especially passionate about a handful of my favorite motives. One of them is the eerie solitude of empty, abandoned places. Locations that were formerly inhabited or used by people, but now lie abandoned.

I would like to publish a book of my best photographs of abandoned places from all over the world. Some of them are not abandoned in the strict sense, just dehumanized enough for my taste :-) These are not just your regular "run of the mill" abandoned houses - each and every location in the book has a story to tell. Some of these places are easy to get to, some required long preparations, meticulous planning, considerable cost and significant risks.

The book is under the working title Without People, and it looks like some weird postscript to human civilization. It's a great gift for travellers, introverts, loners, zombie afficionados or survival freaks. It's incomplete but it looks absolutely great, so far only on my PC though.

Without People is just the first part of a planned photo book trilogy. The second book in the series has the working title Expiations: Stairway to Heaven, and it will feature my favorite photos of religious temples from, well, basically all major (and some minor) world religions. The third book in the trilogy will be about the sea. Everybody loves the sea... but to get there I need to make my first two books successful.

And for that, I need your help!

What I Need and What You Get

By streamlining the production process I managed to cut cost considerably, and can do a beautiful book for a relatively modest sum. I need money to cover the production costs – DTP, proofreading, printing... I would also like to feature some locations I haven't photographed yet.

I can't do this without your valuable contribution. By pledging your support for this project, you get to participate in what will be a unique photographic document of places and locations that are changing basically every day, and some of them may be lost forever sooner than you think.

5% of the money I raise I will donate to a local east european animal charity of my choice.

The book "Without People" will feature a selected passage from the book "Eaarth" by the famous author, academic and environmentalist Bill McKibben, as the foreword! Many thanks to Bill for the special permission to use his text in the foreword - if you like it, please, buy Eaarth by Bill McKibben on Amazon. http://www.billmckibben.com/eaarth/eaarthbook.html

In return for your help you get photographic prints, books, e-books and.... You can see more details in the funding options on the right.

Well that's it folks! Thanks for reading, many MANY thanks for your contribution. Please, contribute, share, like and do everything else people do on this fine thing called Internet... while it's still there... you never know when the apocalypse might strike ;-)

Check out some of the featured photos below! 

All photos are subject to change (these are working versions!), and captions are short, just to give you some idea - most captions in the book will be more substantial. 

Child-sized gas masks in elementary school, Pripyat, Chernobyl zone of exclusion

Ghost town, Nevada, USA

Since this is the cover photo for my campaign, I'll leave the proper caption for the book itself ;-) 

City of the Dead, Cairo, Egypt

Casa  Academiei, Bucharest, Romania (and yes, there are actually people in some photos)

Spring in full swing in one of the depopulated villages in the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone

Naissaar island, Estonia, former Soviet naval mine factory

Former NSA listening post, Teufelsberg, Germany

PERKS!!!

Yay, perks! You're not here to support art, you're here for the PERKS, right? ;-) 

DAS BOOK! - photo book, 70 photos, planned dimensions 22 x 22 cm or 8,5 x 8,5", depends on the funding I get, it won't be smaller than that, possibly bigger

Oakstagram v1.0 and v1.1 - beautiful hand crafted oak frames (20 x 20cm or 8 x 8"), see the description on the right

Wall Beautifier - signed 75 x 50 cm (30" x 20") Photo Print featuring an image of your choice from the book. Here we have some photos in the their natural habitat, a living room. Photos in this picture do not all belong to series "Without People", they are shown for informational purposes

And this is me... I wasn't too keen on putting pics of myself here, but you know, crowdfunding "experts" said "you gotta build trust", "you gotta make personal contact", "you gotta put yourself up front", "you gotta stop being reserved", so I said fine... LOL

Death Valley, USA

In the cockpit of the An-124 Ruslan, a flying giant from Ukraine

Famous ferris wheel of Pripyat, Chernobyl zone...

...and with my buddy Nikša, on the runway 14L of the abandoned, monstrously big airbase Zeljava (Google it). Yes, some pics from Zeljava - both the above ground and the tunnel complex under the mountain - will be in the book...

You're not here to support art, you're here for the PERKS, right? ;-) DAS BOOK! - photo book, 70 photos, planned dimensions 22 x 22 cm or 8,5 x 8,5", depends on the funding I get, it won't be smaller than that, possibly biggerOakstagram v1.0 and v1.1 - beautiful hand crafted oak frames (20 x 20cm or 8 x 8"), see the description on the rightWall Beautifier - signed 75 x 50 cm (30" x 20") Photo Print featuring an image of your choice from the book. Here we have some photos in the their natural habitat, a living room. Photos in this picture do not all belong to series "Without People", they are shown for informational purposesAnd this is me... I wasn't too keen on putting pics of myself here, but you know, crowdfunding "experts" said "you gotta build trust", "you gotta make personal contact", "you gotta put yourself up front", "you gotta stop being reserved", so I said fine... LOL
Death Valley, USAIn the cockpit of the An-124 Ruslan, a flying giant from UkraineFamous ferris wheel of Pripyat, Chernobyl zone......and with my buddy Nikša, on the runway 14L of the abandoned, monstrously big airbase Zeljava (Google it). Yes, some pics from Zeljava - both the above ground and the tunnel complex under the mountain - will be in the book...

story:
Feel the Thrill, the Old & Slow Way . . .

When you find yourself over the hill, it doesn’t automatically mean to slow down. In my case it meant, “go faster”! Turning 50 didn’t suggest I needed to abandon my dream of racing motorcycles – it was the opposite. Racing doesn’t require you to be young, rich, have the best equipment, be the fastest or to win every time. It’s about doing what you love and having the drive and determination to get in the game and be thrilled with just getting to the starting line. It’s about living your dream.

As a kid I raced everywhere I could from Motocross, to hill climbs, to desert races. Over the years I continued to ride, but family and profession consumed most of my time. So when I reached the 50-year mile marker I realized it was time to get serious. Wanting to be the fastest in whatever form of racing I entered. I put together a motorcycle that no one was using for racing and asked my old college friends to join me at the Bonneville Salt Flats. 

Since that first race and over the last 8 seasons, the Old and Slow Team has managed to become the “World’s Fastest KLR” while racing for the world land speed record. We took a 93 mph bike and made it go more than 122 mph, very fast for a common dirt bike. With each new racing season, we continue to tweak and modify these bikes with the anticipation of breaking our own records year over year.

World Land Speed Racing is becoming one of the most exciting, most watched and dangerous sports in motorcycle racing. Because we have a very different looking type of motorcycle, the interest we get from fans, spectators and reporters is overwhelming.  We are constantly talking to people or reporters about the bike, showing off the modifications we’ve done and explaining why we race a Kawasaki KLR Enduro bike.  The team’s number two rider, Bob Canestrini of Tooele, Utah; who also has seen 55 in his rear view mirror, is looking to set a land speed record in 2012 on his newly restored and modified 1980 Honda CB750. Being different is good and has helped set us apart as a racing team.

Our mission is to inspire other people to live their dreams. Its never too late, you’re not too old, and you can afford to do it! Last year at Bonneville, a rider told us it had been his dream to race a motorcycle on the Salt Flats and he was inspired when he saw us race.  Finally at the age of 76, he brought his old Triumph out and raced down the white line.  “It made me feel alive again,” he said.

We won’t win every race or set a new record every year, some races we won’t even finish.  As long as we start we’re happy and living our dream. It is very satisfying to know our efforts have had an impact on people and racing in general.  We welcome you to become part of this unique and special team. Help support this fast growing sport and get your brand or business name noticed by performance enthusiasts at these international events. Thank you for your help and support.

“Just remember, once you're over the hill you begin to pick up speed.”

What We Need 

Eight years ago this started with one bike and one race. We've added two bikes, and three races since then. We run a lean operation, but four races or more a year with 2-3 bikes the costs can add up. Our sponsors have been great, but the economy has hit them hard as well. They donate parts and equipment when they can. What we need is cash to cover the essentials; entrance fees, transporting, food, lodget and gear. Anything above that helps maintain and repair the bikes. We have the need for speed so we are always looking and new modifications and that costs money.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Get the word out! Let your family, friends, collegues know about us. Share the request on FaceBook and your email list.

Best of all, come watch us race. Support this fast growing sport. Either in Texas at the Texas Mile in Beeville, Texas or on the famous Bonneville Salt Flats in Utah. We would love to have you cheering us on.

story:
LEAVING 3/22/13 - 4/1/13

Family TREASURE HUNT 

 

(Actual Picture of Fenn's Chest)

 

Hello, my name is Joey Mendoza.  I'm 17 years old and a senor in high school.  My brother, Josh (14) and I found out about Forrest Fenn's Treasure hidden in New Mexico.  We became fascinated by it.

Since then, we have done a lot of research and think we know where it is.  After showing our dad, he agreed we might be on to something.  Our dad has promised to take us over Spring Break (3/22/13 - 4/1/13) if we could get the money for the trip.

Our Needs

  • Money for hotels, rental SUV, gas, meals, plane tickets, and rental gear like metal detectors and other equipment to document the journey.  

  • If we do not receive all our goal, then we will have to cut our trip really short and lessen our chances of finding it or Not be able to go at all.

What You Get

If we find the treasure and get to keep it, then we will give you a special present for everyone who helped us by donating.  Due to policies of Indiegogo, we are limited to what we can promise but we know it's worth double what you would have donated  :-)  

Also, we will send you an invite to follow our progress via a website dedicated to our journey.  You will be able to read our family blogs, watch videos and see pictures prior to, during and after our trip.

Don't forget to see our perks.   

Once Our Campaign is Funded

My dad will take my brother and I during our high school spring break to look for a real treasure chest full of gold.  

Our family will be able to spend QUALITY time together making memories, just like Forrest Fenn intended when he hid the treasure almost 3 years ago when he thought he was dying of cancer.

A fantasy trip most people only dream of and most kids will never get.  Help fund us and you can feel like your treasure hunting too...through our journey.  

Other Ways You Can Help

March 22 is coming up fast, PLEASE be so kind to share this campaign with others you know. Its pretty easy and you can use Indiegogo's share tools. 

You can follow our progress @ 

Facebook at Forrest Fenn Treasure Chasing.

story:
My name is Matt Narel and I am currently going into my senior year at Quinnipiac University. I am an aspiring cyclist and have been working my way up the ranks. Cycling has become my life and its my way to give back to the help others in need.

Over the past few years I have parterned up with Golden Oppurtunities (http://www.goldenopps.org/) who assist with those that battle isolation, depression and loneliness. On August 4,5,11, and 12 I will be holding bike races for all levels of skill and experience. It doesnt matter if you are a first time rider or a seasoned pro, we are all coming out to have a good time and raise money for a great cause. 

100% of the money raised will go straight to Golden Oppurtunities where it will be used to purchase items such as magazines, books, televisions, and help it become more affordable for a caretaker. 

If anyone is in the Tri-state area or would be interested in coming out racing/riding please email me at mvnarel@quinnpiac.edu

This is a great event with photos being taken, t-shirts and other prizes along the way!

If you know anyone who would be interested in either helping our cause or coming out and riding please spread the word

Thank You

Matt Narel

story:
Over a year in development, the Triage Kit is our most personal product to date.  Transformative construction. Featherweight design. You'll simply never leave home without it.

 

 

We interviewed over 100 outdoor experts, pros and ambassadors to understand what gear they trusted day in and day out.   During this process, one topic kept coming to the surface over and over: The right lightweight emergency kit did not exist.  People were frustrated with the size, weight and lack of key pieces.  So we started with a clean sheet of paper, and the end result, almost a year later, is The Triage Kit.

 

 

W

 

 

Located in Park City, Utah, Uncharted Supply Co's mission is to build gear for the hero in all of us.  From Seal Team 6 to Mother of six, our products let you explore and navigate life with confidence.  If you're in Park City, come visit us at our office on Iron Horse Drive, or send us an email at info@unchartedsupplyco.com.  We're here and ready to serve. 

 

A FEW OF OUR OTHER PRODUCTS

 

The Rapid Raft - Gear of the Show, Outdoor Retailer 2019
and nearly $250,000 on Indiegogo and climbing!

 

 

The game-changing and award winning Seventy2.  
Over $5,000,000 in sales to 150+ countries.

 

 

The 24Seven.  Your everyday backpack, complete with modular card system, and integrated 24 hour first aid kit.

story:
(English Version below)
 

Se sei arrivato fin qui è perchè probabilmente la mia avventura ti incuriosisce, forse addirittura ti interessa. Magari ti chiedi se per affrontare un giro del mondo a vela, senza scalo, da solo, su una barca vintage e senza elettronica devo essere più matto o più coraggioso. Beh, la risposta non ce l’ho nemmeno io. Sicuramente quello che posso dire a te, che stai leggendo la mia pagina del crowdfunding, è che ci sono momenti della vita in cui la passione prevale e diventa incontrollabile, quindi tanto vale incanalarla in ciò che più la può soddisfare. E per me questo è la vela, la vela oceanica in particolare. E quindi ho scelto la Golden Globe Race, la rievocazione del primo giro del mondo a vela in solitario del 1968. Navigherò come si faceva all’epoca, senza elettronica, senza satellitare, senza GPS, senza ausili, solo con il sestante, le carte nautiche, la radio e timone automatico meccanico. 007, la barca che ho scelto per questo viaggio che durerà circa 9 mesi, è una barca solida, resistente, marina. Da tempo ci sto lavorando per adattarla agli sforzi che dovrà sopportare, per preparare e ottimizzare gli interni, togliere il superfluo e rafforzare le strutture portanti perché in mezzo agli oceani del sud con onde di 10-15 metri saremo solo io e lei.

 

Fin qui sono arrivato con le mie forze e grazie a qualche partner tecnico che mi ha aiutato con materiale e forniture. Speravo di poter tenere gli alberi originali di 007 ma, fatte le opportune verifiche, ho deciso di cambiarli per ragioni di sicurezza. Sono coraggioso, mica matto.

PER FARE UN ALBERO CI VUOLE… E FIGURATI PER FARNE DUE!

Come hai visto nel video, prima 007 aveva un albero solo. Per motivi di affidabilità, equilibrio in navigazione, sicurezza, ho deciso di trasformarla in un ketch, quindi di aggiungere a quello maestro anche un secondo albero. Ho interpellato vari costruttori e fornitori e ho già preordinato i due alberi, fiducioso di riuscire a trovare le risorse. Quindi ho deciso di lanciare questo crowdfunding per raccogliere la cifra che serve per dare alla barca gli alberi che si merita.

E mi sono chiesto: ma perché mai qualcuno dovrebbe sostenere la mia avventura?

 

Se hai una passione bruciante sai sicuramente quanto è difficile realizzare un sogno. Magari navighi anche tu e capisci bene quanto il richiamo del mare sia forte e irrinunciabile. O magari pensi che l’unico italiano che partecipa a una regata oceanica internazionale merita un sostegno. Forse sei un appassionato di vintage e ti piace il fatto che alla Golden Globe Race ci si orienta con il sole e le stelle, si mantiene la barca in rotta con autopilota meccanico e si naviga senza l'ausilio di elettronica. Mi piace pensare che la mia avventura possa essere d’ispirazione e allora - per empatia e pura generosità - mi darai una mano. O, semplicemente, credi che sarebbe un peccato essere arrivato fin qui e non completare il lavoro sulla barca con due alberi nuovi, solidi, sicuri.

 

Insomma, anche qui la verità è che non ho una risposta: no so né se sosterrai il mio progetto né perché. Da parte mia ho cercato di proporre delle ricompense interessanti, speciali, uniche e spero proprio che tu possa trovare quella che fa per te: dal portachiavi di 007 fatto con il legno di 007 alle foto scattate a bordo (rigorosamente in pellicola) e stampate in modo artigianale (eh già, il vintage è un mio pallino). Potremo navigare insieme per un paio di giorni prima della partenza, o per un periodo più lungo al ritorno. Le opzioni sono tante: per te, da condividere, per un regalo o per un gruppo.

 

A me non resta che ringraziarti per aver letto fin qui e ti chiedo - qualunque sia la tua scelta rispetto al sostegno e alla ricompensa - di condividere questa pagina con i tuoi contatti. La differenza si fa se partecipano in tanti.


Del resto, può sembrare assurdo ma per un giro del mondo in solitario c’è bisogno di un grosso equipaggio!

 

In tanti mi hanno chiesto di donare tramite Paypal o IBAN. Non esitate a contattarmi se avete questa necessità. Per procedere invece attraverso questo sito con carta di credito (transazione sicura), qui un video che vi illustra come fare:

ENG

If you’ve gotten this far, it might be because the adventure I’m undertaking has you really curious. You might be asking yourself: to sail non-stop around the world, all alone, on a vintage boat completely unassisted? This guy’s crazy! Or maybe just has guts. Even I don’t have the answer! What I can tell you is that you’re reading my crowdfunding page and that there are moments in life in which your passion prevails over all else and is unstoppable. Then the only thing you can do is channel it into whatever can quench that passion.

 

For me, that passion is sailing, ocean sailing specifically. So I bought 007, an Endurance 35 sailboat for the Golden Globe Race, which will be the 2nd edition of the famous Sunday Times Golden Globe that first took place half-century ago in 1968. The GGR is all about sailing the old-school way: a sextant, mechanical self-steering gear, no electronics allowed, aboard a beautiful, long-keeled vintage sailboat for approximately 9 months. For the past several months, I’ve been refitting my boat, stripping out the unnecessary details, reinforcing the structure, and optimizing the interior to make it strong enough to face unforgiving Southern Ocean storms that can generate waves up to 10-15 metres high. It will be me and 007 facing off nature alone. 007 is solid. Resistent. And it’s seaworthy.

 

Now is the moment that I’m facing big expenses. I need to purchase two new, custom-built masts for 007: a main-mast and a mizzen-mast. So far, I’ve been relying on my own resources and the help of many friends and suppliers for materials and in-kind services. My original plan was to salvage 007’s mast. After doing research, I determined that for safety reasons, I need to get new ones. There’s no other way to face the fury of the Southern Ocean without new, extremely resistant -- and reliable -- masts.

 

TO BUILD ONE MAST YOU NEED…...GO FIGURE FOR TWO!

As you saw in the video, 007 used to have only one mast.  We know originally that it was a ketch and had two masts. At some point, 007 was refurbished, possibly to save money or to follow some trend at the time. I decided to restore the boat to how it was before, and what promises to guarantee optimum balance during navigation, reliability and safety. Confident in my quest to find the funds, I’ve contacted a builder and have already pre-ordered the two new masts. They’re costly. That’s when I decided to launch a crowdfunding campaign so that 007 gets the two masts she rightly deserves. I’ve asked myself many times: why should someone lend their support to me for this race?

 

If you have a burning passion, you know how hard it is to realize your dream. Maybe you also sail and can relate to the how strong the call of the sea is. You might think that the only Italian taking part in this international race around the world deserves my support. Maybe you’re passionate about everything vintage and like the idea that Golden Globe Race is all about navigating by the sun and the stars. That you keep your boat on course using a mechanical autopilot without any reliance on electronical gadgets. Or you might think it would be a shame to reach this point and not be able to give 007 two new, reliable masts. I’d like to think that my adventure can inspire others. Whether out of empathy or generosity, I’m asking you for your in undertaking this journey.

 

Truth be told, I don’t have a response as to whether you’ll support my project or even why.  But, I will offer you something of value in return. I’ve come up with a range of really special, unique rewards, from keyholders inscribed with “007” and actually made out of 007’s original wood. How about series of stills taken aboard 007 (rigorously shot on film) and printed using artisanal techniques (vintage-style is how I roll!). A two-day sailing trip with me before the race starts or even a longer trip after I return. There are so many options: gift to yourself or that someone special, or even a group of people.

 

All that’s left is to say thank you for having read this all the way through. Whatever you choose as a reward for your generosity, please share my page with others. Getting the word out far and wide is the only way to make a difference.

 

It might seem absurd, but to make a solo journey around the world you really need a big crew!

Per motivi di affidabilità, equilibrio in navigazione, sicurezza, ho deciso di trasformarla in un ketch, quindi di aggiungere a quello maestro anche un secondo albero. Ho interpellato vari costruttori e fornitori e ho già preordinato i due alberi, fiducioso di riuscire a trovare le risorse. Quindi ho deciso di lanciare questo crowdfunding per raccogliere la cifra che serve per dare alla barca gli alberi che si merita.E mi sono chiesto: ma perché mai qualcuno dovrebbe sostenere la mia avventura? Se hai una passione bruciante sai sicuramente quanto è difficile realizzare un sogno. Magari navighi anche tu e capisci bene quanto il richiamo del mare sia forte e irrinunciabile. O magari pensi che l’unico italiano che partecipa a una regata oceanica internazionale merita un sostegno. Forse sei un appassionato di vintage e ti piace il fatto che alla Golden Globe Race ci si orienta con il sole e le stelle, si mantiene la barca in rotta con autopilota meccanico e si naviga senza l'ausilio di elettronica. Mi piace pensare che la mia avventura possa essere d’ispirazione e allora - per empatia e pura generosità - mi darai una mano. O, semplicemente, credi che sarebbe un peccato essere arrivato fin qui e non completare il lavoro sulla barca con due alberi nuovi, solidi, sicuri. Insomma, anche qui la verità è che non ho una risposta: no so né se sosterrai il mio progetto né perché. Da parte mia ho cercato di proporre delle ricompense interessanti, speciali, uniche e spero proprio che tu possa trovare quella che fa per te: dal portachiavi di 007 fatto con il legno di 007 alle foto scattate a bordo (rigorosamente in pellicola) e stampate in modo artigianale (eh già, il vintage è un mio pallino). Potremo navigare insieme per un paio di giorni prima della partenza, o per un periodo più lungo al ritorno. Le opzioni sono tante: per te, da condividere, per un regalo o per un gruppo. A me non resta che ringraziarti per aver letto fin qui e ti chiedo - qualunque sia la tua scelta rispetto al sostegno e alla ricompensa - di condividere questa pagina con i tuoi contatti. La differenza si fa se partecipano in tanti.Del resto, può sembrare assurdo ma per un giro del mondo in solitario c’è bisogno di un grosso equipaggio! In tanti mi hanno chiesto di donare tramite Paypal o IBAN. Non esitate a contattarmi se avete questa necessità. Per procedere invece attraverso questo sito con carta di credito (transazione sicura), qui un video che vi illustra come fare:ENGIf you’ve gotten this far, it might be because the adventure I’m undertaking has you really curious. You might be asking yourself: to sail non-stop around the world, all alone, on a vintage boat completely unassisted? This guy’s crazy! Or maybe just has guts. Even I don’t have the answer! What I can tell you is that you’re reading my crowdfunding page and that there are moments in life in which your passion prevails over all else and is unstoppable. Then the only thing you can do is channel it into whatever can quench that passion. For me, that passion is sailing, ocean sailing specifically. So I bought 007, an Endurance 35 sailboat for the Golden Globe Race, which will be the 2nd edition of the famous Sunday Times Golden Globe that first took place half-century ago in 1968. The GGR is all about sailing the old-school way: a sextant, mechanical self-steering gear, no electronics allowed, aboard a beautiful, long-keeled vintage sailboat for approximately 9 months. For the past several months, I’ve been refitting my boat, stripping out the unnecessary details, reinforcing the structure, and optimizing the interior to make it strong enough to face unforgiving Southern Ocean storms that can generate waves up to 10-15 metres high. It will be me and 007 facing off nature alone. 007 is solid. Resistent. And it’s seaworthy. Now is the moment that I’m facing big expenses. I need to purchase two new, custom-built masts for 007: a main-mast and a mizzen-mast. So far, I’ve been relying on my own resources and the help of many friends and suppliers for materials and in-kind services. My original plan was to salvage 007’s mast. After doing research, I determined that for safety reasons, I need to get new ones. There’s no other way to face the fury of the Southern Ocean without new, extremely resistant -- and reliable -- masts. TO BUILD ONE MAST YOU NEED…...GO FIGURE FOR TWO!As you saw in the video, 007 used to have only one mast.  We know originally that it was a ketch and had two masts. At some point, 007 was refurbished, possibly to save money or to follow some trend at the time. I decided to restore the boat to how it was before, and what promises to guarantee optimum balance during navigation, reliability and safety. Confident in my quest to find the funds, I’ve contacted a builder and have already pre-ordered the two new masts. They’re costly. That’s when I decided to launch a crowdfunding campaign so that 007 gets the two masts she rightly deserves. I’ve asked myself many times: why should someone lend their support to me for this race? If you have a burning passion, you know how hard it is to realize your dream. Maybe you also sail and can relate to the how strong the call of the sea is. You might think that the only Italian taking part in this international race around the world deserves my support. Maybe you’re passionate about everything vintage and like the idea that Golden Globe Race is all about navigating by the sun and the stars. That you keep your boat on course using a mechanical autopilot without any reliance on electronical gadgets. Or you might think it would be a shame to reach this point and not be able to give 007 two new, reliable masts. I’d like to think that my adventure can inspire others. Whether out of empathy or generosity, I’m asking you for your in undertaking this journey. Truth be told, I don’t have a response as to whether you’ll support my project or even why.  But, I will offer you something of value in return. I’ve come up with a range of really special, unique rewards, from keyholders inscribed with “007” and actually made out of 007’s original wood. How about series of stills taken aboard 007 (rigorously shot on film) and printed using artisanal techniques (vintage-style is how I roll!). A two-day sailing trip with me before the race starts or even a longer trip after I return. There are so many options: gift to yourself or that someone special, or even a group of people. All that’s left is to say thank you for having read this all the way through. Whatever you choose as a reward for your generosity, please share my page with others. Getting the word out far and wide is the only way to make a difference. It might seem absurd, but to make a solo journey around the world you really need a big crew!

story:
Dear Family and Friends,

 

In the past six years, the Gulf Coast of the United States has been hit by major hurricanes and an oil spill.  Most of the country could do little but watch and pray for the people whose lives were torn apart.  Devastated communities throughout Louisiana and Mississippi still need help.

 

Instead of continuing to watch helplessly, I will be joining a group of students from UCLA Hillel as we travel to New Orleans with PJA & JFSJ this spring break.  Our goal is to not only help local organizations in any way they need, but to learn about the community in an attempt to understand how the challenges they are struggling with developed and learn what we can do in the long run to make positive change.  While many students look forward to spending their break relaxing at home or going on vacation, I am committing myself to service and learning.

           

I am looking forward to the trip, but the cost is a concern.  The cost will be about $1000 for the seven-day trip, including transportation. Our group is planning several fundraisers to help raise money and awareness, but any assistance you can provide will be of great help.  In addition, by passing this message along to your friends and colleagues you will already be helping us achieve our goal of spreading awareness of the ongoing need in Gulf Coast communities. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

 

I am very much looking forward to this rewarding experience and returning with new perspectives on the importance of service to our nation.  I hope to bring the skills and knowledge from my experience in New Orleans back home to work on a project in our community. Your help will make this possible. 

 

Thank you for your time and consideration.  I will be sure to update you when I return.

Sincerely,

Chantelle Ghiam

story:
100% OF PROCEEDS GO TO CHARITY

The charity, Wheels 4 Life, is a non-profit charity (501c(3)), that provides free bicycles for people in need of transportation in Third World countries - $150 IS THE COST OF BRINGING A SINGLE BICYCLE TO A PERSON IN NEED. They partner with local individuals, organizations and other groups to help them identify persons who sincerely need a bike to be able to go to school or to work. Often these people live in very primitive and remote areas with no access or means to public transportation. The closest school, doctor or work-place might be 10 or 20 miles away. Having a bike can make all the difference in somebody’s life and can give them a chance to break out of the vicious poverty cycle. The gift of mobility, in form of a bicycles, can do maricles.

Wheels 4 Life has delivered 4972 bikes in 20 countries around the world.

We are leaving from our hometown of San Jose (1 hour south of San Francisco) on May 28th, and hope to raise at least $1,500 for Wheels 4 Life. We both started off the year looking for a life-enriching, adventurous, and worthwhile project, and after much debate we settled on Bike 2 BC. The trip will take us up and down the west coast, take approximately two and a half months, and cover around 3000 miles. We hope that through our efforts we can help this wonderful organization help those who could most benefit from the use of a bicycle.

Thank you so much for your support!!!

To learn more, visit http://www.wheels4life.org/

story:
Major update!

Geek Field Guide is going to Europe!

We have received enough funding via this Indiegogo campaign and outside sources that we will be proceeding on the project.

Now any additional funding we get lengthens the duration of the trip, and improves our ability to provide more photos and reference material for you.

If you haven't seen already, we added two perk tiers for those who wanted a photo book.

Back us now to help select where we go!

 

What is Geek Field Guide?

We want to create a comprehensive texture, reference photo, video, audio, and photogrammetry library of locations throughout Europe.

We will be working with Indiegogo individual backers, game studios and outsource shops, writers, artists, and more to create a massive media library of Europe.

As an example of what we will create for you, we made a two-hour trip to Duke Chapel, in Durham, NC.

View the gallery here, or download the entire photo set: (Password: geekfieldguide)

http://gallery.geekfieldguide.com/gallery-collection/Duke-Chapel/C0000HraT9OKhK44

To further help you immerse yourself in the environment, we will release 3D models or Synths on Photosynth:

Photogrammetry-based sample models:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/y8zswr0bsn2aptx/l4W3T_hjEh

Photosynth:

Duke Chapel Interior:
http://photosynth.net/view.aspx?cid=9652bade-784c-48a1-b1b9-b7cd5c652b97

Duke Chapel Exterior:
http://photosynth.net/view.aspx?cid=69b18ebb-5fa1-41f7-b202-1a960b228648

In March, we traveled to Bryce Canyon National Park, in Utah, as the first ‘proof of concept’ for this project.

View the Gallery here:
http://geekfieldguide.photoshelter.com/gallery/2013-Bryce-Canyon-in-Winter/G0000EGoNfvUYkXE/C0000Xzww6x0LeJk

View the blogs here:
http://geekfieldguide.com/

We also plan to blog, video blog, provide audio commentaries, and otherwise document the journey from a narrative standpoint for writers and designers. As you can see in the pitch video, we aren’t limiting this project to environments. If you need us to go and experience something, while documenting it via head-mounted camera, we can make it happen.

For more updates and materials, see our Facebook page here:

https://www.facebook.com/GeekFieldGuide

How will backers be involved?

All backers at the $10 or higher level will get access to private forums where we will discuss our itinerary.

We do not know which locations we are going to yet. That is up to our backers. (You!) 

Lower-level backers get to provide requests for where we go. We’ll run polls to see the most popular suggestions and help us decide our route.

Backers at the director or studio levels get a full day of our time (subject to legal, political, safety, and other restrictions. See the FAQ for further details).

What does Geek Field Guide offer that isn’t attainable through a photo texture site?

There are a number of really high-quality texture sites out there. We do not feel that we compete with them, but actually complement their offerings.

They offer a wide variety of art for an equally-diverse number of settings.

We offer focused packages of a region that is documented so that you can know that you are accurately replicating the environment you create (whether for games, writing, art, or any other creative project you work on) with certainty.

Europe is our first destination. We plan to provide our services on-demand in the future.

Why are you doing this?

We looked at the current offerings for content creators, and found that while there are many offerings of high quality texture photos available, we found no evidence of providing a full set of reference materials on demand for specific locations.

We both have a passion for learning and sharing that knowledge with others, whether it is via photography, storytelling, or writing. For a number of years, I have considered a project like this, but the costs to run it properly were prohibitive for a small company. Modern technology allows a team of two to travel across the globe and provide customized information to supporters with rapid iteration and feedback with high fidelity.

 

Why video blogs and focus on Adventure in the promotional video?

There are a lot of things that you miss about an environment by simply taking photos of it.

We could simply write terse, analytical notes about the location, or we could show you and tell you. We decided on a travel documentary format, in the vein of Michael West, would be far more useful to our supporters. By mixing written, video, and audio commentary, we are able to show you what it means to walk down the streets of some ancient place, or engage in a martial art from a first-person perspective. (See the video for a demonstration.)

If a picture is worth a thousand words, at 30 frames per second, that’s a lot of words.

Who is Geek Field Guide:

Warren Schultz: Photographer, Game Developer, Writer, Artist, Tinkerer. Game Industry veteran since 1999, who has worked for some of the best-known studios in the industry. Currently lives in North Carolina.

Cynthia Kazanis: Anthropologist, Archaeologist, Martial Artist, Researcher, Photographer. Currently assistant instructor at a martial arts school in Michigan.

Special Thanks:

Brian Lee and Micah Moore of Beat Down Boogie for their martial arts work, check out their films here: http://beatdownboogie.com/

Stretch goals!

Stretch goal #1: $60,000. Creative Commons Astronomy Unlock!

In collaboration with Dr. Pamela L. Gay, we will take 185-degree panorama photos of the night sky. These photos are ideal for use in planetarium shows, and will be donated to the Science on the Half-Sphere project at Cosmoquest (http://cosmoquest.org) for education use by all under the Creative Commons (Attribution-NonCommercial) license.

What is Cosmoquest? From their site:

“Our goal is to create a community of people bent on together advancing our understanding of the universe; a community of people who are participating in doing science, who can explain why what they do matters, and what questions they are helping to answer. We want to create a community, and here is where we invite all of you to be a part of what we’re doing.”

Stretch goal #2: ???? Unlock stretch goal #1 to find out!

See the Updates page for the answers to your Frequently Asked Questions!

story:
the SKILLZBOARD

The Skillzboard is a versatile tool for rock climbers that provides a portable, weight-bearing solution for learning, practicing, and teaching rope systems and anchor techniques in a realistic and safe environment.

 

The Problem

Rock climbing, especially indoor climbing, has seen an explosion in popularity recently, and the sport’s eventual Olympic debut is likely to make a substantial contribution as well. If you are someone who has never rope climbed outdoors, you may just get the desire to do so at some point (it’s pretty cool). Before you get too excited though, it is important to realize that the safety of yourself and others relies on additional skills that aren't typically learned by climbing indoors.

In the past, these skills have typically been passed down by a mentor, but YouTube is definitely a thing, and it’s pretty neat. However, watching a video doesn’t automatically translate to proficiency of a skill without a bit of discipline. Practicing rope systems and anchor techniques is also difficult without being able to access an actual wall equipped with climbing hardware.

 

The Solution

The Skillzboard simulates a typical bolted anchor found at the top of many climbing routes, and can be fully weighted by the user anywhere from their humble abode to the crag. This realistic experience creates a better learning process and increases retention of knowledge. The Skillzboard is a useful tool for new and experienced climbers alike, and can be used to teach and practice a large variety of skills: cleaning a sport anchor, building a top belay system, escaping the belay, self-rescue methods, big wall techniques, and much more.

 

Mounting Capabilities

Our patent pending mounting systems allow you to easily set up the Skillzboard in just a minute or two - no tools required!

 

Over-The-Door

If you own or rent a door, you can practice your technical skills. Using the CHOCKBOARD, simply drape the daisy strap over the door, close the door, and get practicing!

 

Pull-up Bar

You can also use your handy-dandy doorway pull-up bar to easily mount the Skillzboard using the daisy strap or a pair of carabiners or quickdraws.

 

Tree / Pole

Sling a strong, happy tree (or pole) anywhere from your backyard to the crag and get practicing! Just tighten the strap around the trunk, clip the Skillzboard to the daisy loops, and you’re on your way to mastery.

 

Vehicle

Using a similar setup to the over-the-door mount, turn your rad vehicle into a mobile practice station! Padded strips on the back protect your windows from scratches.

 

Other Features

 

Got some spare holds lying around? Throw ‘em on the Skillzboard and get stronger! A center jug is also nice for weighting/unweighting your personal anchor.

 

 

 

the CHOCKBOARD

Don't let good looks fool you, this sidekick has your back on every step of your training journey. Use the SKILLZBOARD hardware and our Fast Straps to mount over any door and practice anchors from the comfort of the home, or the convenience of your car. 

 

Slots / Holes

This multipurpose accessory helps you hang your SKILLZBOARD from any door, and doubles as a hangboard and pinchblock when you're ready to trade the classroom for the gym. When you're done hitting the books, the CHOCKBOARD easily converts to the strength training tool with surprising versatility.  

 

Sustainability

We have partnered with a local manufacturer in Wisconsin to make our products. Our shipping envelopes are made from 100% recycled material, which is also recyclable, biodegradable, and compostable. Our T-shirts are made of 30% recycled cotton, 30% cotton & 40% rPET* polyester. We have already taken a number of steps to be a more eco-friendly company, but we strive to continuously improve our sustainability. Your contributions will help us do our part to help the environment.

*While rPET fabric isn’t perfectly sustainable, we feel that it helps keep plastic out of landfills and oceans and is a step in the right direction.

 

History / Prototypes

Our team developed the first version of the Skillzboard for a prototyping competition at the University of Wisconsin - Platteville in 2019, where it won second prize. With grant funding and several rounds of further development and testing, the Skillzboard went on to win awards at the Wisconsin Science and Technology Symposium’s Innovation Showcase later on in the year. We then took advantage of the recent COVID-19 shelter-at-home measures to remotely redesign the Skillzboard until we arrived at a salable product.

Check out our website at skillzboard.com to learn more.

 

Skillzboard LLC: The Team

The members of our team united through the Outdoor Adventure Club at the University of Wisconsin - Platteville. We all held leadership roles in the club, and introduced many people to rock climbing and other outdoor activities. We're all pretty weird, too.

Gokul Gopal - President & Director of Wisdom

Materials Engineer ~ Physicist ~ Educator ~ Several years of outdoor leadership/mentorship ~ Into rock, ice and alpine climbing 

Brian Tuttle - Operations & Manufacturing

Mechanical Engineer ~ Former president of the Outdoor Adventure Club ~ Choss Boss ~ Needs: good feet at the start and good jugs at the end 

Bobby Hebel - Head of R&D

Mechanical Engineer ~ Quickdraw Clipper / Pebble Wrestler ~ Trail Building Wizard ~ Silly Dood Boxdrum Whacker ~ South Lake Tahoe “Local” ~ Detail-oriented ~ Fun = Priority

Chloe Thomas - Social Media Slinger

Mechanical Engineer ~ desperately trying to avoid sitting at a desk for too long ~ MTB Ripper ~ Youtuber ~ Refuses to touch Tiktok ~ will do anything for a laugh 

Seneida Biendarra - Tech Guru

Industrial Engineer ~ Philmont Guide ~ Crack Climbing n00b ~ Coffee Aficionado ~ Unique Human ~ Bike Commuter for Life
story_txt:
the SKILLZBOARD
The Skillzboard is a versatile tool for rock climbers that provides a portable, weight-bearing solution for learning, practicing, and teaching rope systems and anchor techniques in a realistic and safe environment. The ProblemRock climbing, especially indoor climbing, has seen an explosion in popularity recently, and the sport’s eventual Olympic debut is likely to make a substantial contribution as well. If you are someone who has never rope climbed outdoors, you may just get the desire to do so at some point (it’s pretty cool). Before you get too excited though, it is important to realize that the safety of yourself and others relies on additional skills that aren't typically learned by climbing indoors.In the past, these skills have typically been passed down by a mentor, but YouTube is definitely a thing, and it’s pretty neat. However, watching a video doesn’t automatically translate to proficiency of a skill without a bit of discipline. Practicing rope systems and anchor techniques is also difficult without being able to access an actual wall equipped with climbing hardware. The SolutionThe Skillzboard simulates a typical bolted anchor found at the top of many climbing routes, and can be fully weighted by the user anywhere from their humble abode to the crag. This realistic experience creates a better learning process and increases retention of knowledge. The Skillzboard is a useful tool for new and experienced climbers alike, and can be used to teach and practice a large variety of skills: cleaning a sport anchor, building a top belay system, escaping the belay, self-rescue methods, big wall techniques, and much more. Mounting CapabilitiesOur patent pending mounting systems allow you to easily set up the Skillzboard in just a minute or two - no tools required! Over-The-DoorIf you own or rent a door, you can practice your technical skills. Using the CHOCKBOARD, simply drape the daisy strap over the door, close the door, and get practicing! Pull-up BarYou can also use your handy-dandy doorway pull-up bar to easily mount the Skillzboard using the daisy strap or a pair of carabiners or quickdraws. Tree / PoleSling a strong, happy tree (or pole) anywhere from your backyard to the crag and get practicing! Just tighten the strap around the trunk, clip the Skillzboard to the daisy loops, and you’re on your way to mastery. VehicleUsing a similar setup to the over-the-door mount, turn your rad vehicle into a mobile practice station! Padded strips on the back protect your windows from scratches. Other Features Got some spare holds lying around? Throw ‘em on the Skillzboard and get stronger! A center jug is also nice for weighting/unweighting your personal anchor.   the CHOCKBOARDDon't let good looks fool you, this sidekick has your back on every step of your training journey. Use the SKILLZBOARD hardware and our Fast Straps to mount over any door and practice anchors from the comfort of the home, or the convenience of your car.  Slots / HolesThis multipurpose accessory helps you hang your SKILLZBOARD from any door, and doubles as a hangboard and pinchblock when you're ready to trade the classroom for the gym. When you're done hitting the books, the CHOCKBOARD easily converts to the strength training tool with surprising versatility.   SustainabilityWe have partnered with a local manufacturer in Wisconsin to make our products. Our shipping envelopes are made from 100% recycled material, which is also recyclable, biodegradable, and compostable. Our T-shirts are made of 30% recycled cotton, 30% cotton & 40% rPET* polyester. We have already taken a number of steps to be a more eco-friendly company, but we strive to continuously improve our sustainability. Your contributions will help us do our part to help the environment.*While rPET fabric isn’t perfectly sustainable, we feel that it helps keep plastic out of landfills and oceans and is a step in the right direction. History / PrototypesOur team developed the first version of the Skillzboard for a prototyping competition at the University of Wisconsin - Platteville in 2019, where it won second prize. With grant funding and several rounds of further development and testing, the Skillzboard went on to win awards at the Wisconsin Science and Technology Symposium’s Innovation Showcase later on in the year. We then took advantage of the recent COVID-19 shelter-at-home measures to remotely redesign the Skillzboard until we arrived at a salable product.Check out our website at skillzboard.com to learn more. Skillzboard LLC: The TeamThe members of our team united through the Outdoor Adventure Club at the University of Wisconsin - Platteville. We all held leadership roles in the club, and introduced many people to rock climbing and other outdoor activities. We're all pretty weird, too.Gokul Gopal - President & Director of WisdomMaterials Engineer ~ Physicist ~ Educator ~ Several years of outdoor leadership/mentorship ~ Into rock, ice and alpine climbing Brian Tuttle - Operations & ManufacturingMechanical Engineer ~ Former president of the Outdoor Adventure Club ~ Choss Boss ~ Needs: good feet at the start and good jugs at the end Bobby Hebel - Head of R&DMechanical Engineer ~ Quickdraw Clipper / Pebble Wrestler ~ Trail Building Wizard ~ Silly Dood Boxdrum Whacker ~ South Lake Tahoe “Local” ~ Detail-oriented ~ Fun = PriorityChloe Thomas - Social Media SlingerMechanical Engineer ~ desperately trying to avoid sitting at a desk for too long ~ MTB Ripper ~ Youtuber ~ Refuses to touch Tiktok ~ will do anything for a laugh Seneida Biendarra - Tech GuruIndustrial Engineer ~ Philmont Guide ~ Crack Climbing n00b ~ Coffee Aficionado ~ Unique Human ~ Bike Commuter for Life

story:
Welcome to Social City!


Remember the time when people used to meet other people on the streets, coffee shops, clubs, etc? Remember how interesting and fun it was? Remember how many social contacts we made with the help of chats and IRC? (We are not talking about meeting people online, we're talking about making connections online and then meeting in real life :))

Ok, even if you don't remember - imagine! :) Imagine that there was a time (and we hope that it is not forgotten) when then word "social" wasn't associated with the word "network". 

We are trying our best to bring those happy real-life social events back to life!

Imagine that you are in another country (this is easy) and you want to meet some of the locals or to have a tour. There are few options - find a company, which will give you a tour, ask a local to help you out or use Social City App. 

Our apps works in very easy and understandable way. Social City puts you on the map for 1 hour with your message (You want a tour, remember?). And every user nearby you can see this message and text you back. Yes, you can post the question on Facebook, but you are far away, remember?

 

Or, for example, you are feeling lonely today and want to offer a drink to girl/guy? Or a flat tire in the middle on Nowhere? Or maybe you have an urge to tell everyone around that there is a suspicious person nearby? Those are just samples of what you can do with Social City App. The rest is up to you! :) 

 

We like to keep thing clean and simple. Just drop a line to a person you want to meet, negotiate time and place, and that is it :) No complicated registration forms, no unnecessary donations, nothing that can disappoint you. We really want to see this app live and we really do need your support!

NB!- We are in the demo stage and if you want to have an early-bird access, just drop us a line and we will think of something ^_^Even if you can't support us right now - just share this to your friends.

Thank you!
You are awesome!

P.S.- Hope your homescreen will soon also have this awesome icon.

story:
Imagine: year 1977., you are sailing a 6.5 wooden sailboat across the Atlantic, soaked wet in a wool jumper with a piece of nylon bag put over in case of rain. Those were some tough times. Today, the Mini Transat is still known as one of the toughest races for single-handed sailors. It is sailed in two stages - from La Rochelle in France to Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, and from Las Palmas to La Marin in Martinique - a total of 4.000 nautical miles. In this year's edition, there are 84 competitors from 14 countries worldwide competing in being the fastest across the Atlantic Ocean. Sail, eat, sleep, calculate routes, trim, change sails - over and over again. While being solo, with no communication rather than a VHF radio. For 30 days at sea. No cell phones, no Internet, no computers - a true solo experience.

With your help I can do it, too. Seeing it is a pretty complicated and expensive project below is the cost estimate in a 3 years cycle:

Boat: 30.000 € (used, of course)

Deck equipment, hardware and rigging: 12.000 €

Electronics: 7.000 €

Sails: 10.000 €

Regatta fees: 6.000 €

Trailer & boat transport: 9.000 €

Personal expenses, food, clothes, accommodation: 8,000 €

So I've set the campaign goal at 5.000 $ which I will use for the safe return of Eloa back to Europe. And than the planning of the next project can begin.. :)

story:
~ About the Badger App ~

Badger uses electronic badges as a reward system for goal-oriented incentives designed by an administrator of their social network - for FREE. The User Interface makes creating a group, designating point values to badges and their respective tasks for earning those badges, fun and easy! Badger turns everyone into a winner based on their own merit. Share your badges with you friends, brag about it, send positive comments, and grow as an individual or as a community.

The idea first came from a desire to improve the involvement of high school students in academic and extracurricular activities.  The concept of progressive accomplishment assessment uses electronic based reward systems that are implemented through a mobile application such as the iPhone, Android, or other popular devices.  The concept of reinforcing a student’s achievements through reward based systems is nothing new.  In fact the use of physical trophies to reward children, teens, tweens, and young adults within various organizational structures of academic and extracurricular activities are common practice.  At one point the distribution of trophies were only issued for “winners” (1st, 2nd, or 3rd places), then the perspective on issuing trophies only to selected few were believed to foster negative undertones so then everyone became winners.  

In the Millennia generation trophies are given to all, but that might not be such a bad thing. The Badger is slightly different from awarding the youth for winning or losing, but uses awards as markers of progress towards a greater prize where the definition of the prize is self-generated or by an administrator.  In this case, everyone by definition can still be winners by earning “badges”.  The badges can become useful tools to identify more specific moments of deviation or excelling progress during a journey towards becoming a winner and not just recognize individuals for final outcomes.  The concept attempts to incorporate the stimulation received from trophy-like indicators that measures progress, whether they are physical trophies or electronic badges, as steppingstones for encouraging ritualistic good-behavior driven by an ultimate prize.  

What We Need & What You Get

Okay, here's the breakdown.  The production of the application will begin on Monday - 8.18.2014.  The cost of development on the iPhone is priced at $19,500. Thus far the funding has all been through me.  There's nothing like putting my money where my mouth is, and in this case I have and will continue to put about 85% of my pay check into the development of this application.  Not to mention the 60+ hours spent on designing each screen.  

I am asking for $30,000.  Below are the different uses of the funding.

Phase 1 is the execution of the application to ensure that it is easy to navigate and intuitive.  The application is estimated to be completed in 16 weeks from the date above.  At the time of this presentation, I have already placed $3,900 to start the application and have a payment plan with the developers at Sunflower Labs LLC of $2,000 every 4 weeks.  (Using math) At this rate, there will be no way I can fund this project alone without delaying the release into the iPhone app store for an additional 16 weeks.  But if that is what it takes then that is what will be done.  At week 16, I will have funded $11,900 myself leaving me with an outstanding balance of $7,600.  

After Phase 1: $30,000 - $7,600 = $22,400.

Phase 2 will be to market the application, build the badge library, and expand onto the iPad ($5,000) and Android phones and tablets ($8,000) to allow all mobile users access to the application.

After Phase 2: $22,400 - $13,000 =  $9,400.

Phase 3 will include a 3-d printer.  A major part of the business is create a market for electronic badges but to not simply limit it to digital.  The badges that are earned by the user's own merit holds a personal value that symbolizes a step within a journey.  The same joy that is received from holding a trophy, can be brought to life by providing users the option to 3-D print the badges.  Imagine the possibilities and co-creative work that could derive from it!  The remaining $9,400 balance will be used to purchase a 3-D printer and create a foundation for the delivery system to the valued users and cover unexpected costs of running new business.  

    ~ Varying Uses ~

    The following section will list the various scenarios for the use of the application with varying participant size:

    1. Individual use:

    Suppose a user sets up a profile and within it is a section for personal use.  For this example, the goal will be called “Lose Weight/Gain Strength.”  The user designates a badge for every 100 push-ups, another badge for completing 100 sit-ups, and another for completing 50 pull-ups.  For a month, the user honestly awards himself /herself badges based on their performance and the application keeps track and conceptualizes their earnings for tracing and motivational purposes.  At the end of the month, the user sees that they have earned 40 total badges (20 push-badges, 15 sit-up badges, and 5 pull up badges).  The badges translate to a measurable action where in this case within a month’s time, the user performed:

    20 badges   x   100 pushups   = 2,000 push-ups

    15 badges    x   100 sit-ups   = 1,500 sit-ups

    5 badges   x  50 pull-ups   = 250 pull-ups

    One of my favorite example that I would use this app for is exercise.  Everywhere there is a major push to promote healthy lifestyle by incorporating exercise as part of your daily routine.  Among your friends you create a group, and put down the various steps to becoming fit by issuing a task to a badge, in this case you would earn a badge for completing different exercises routine that your group decides on.  The thing that makes it special is when it becomes social. So now, for every time an individual complete an exercise, everyone in that group will receive a notification that hey one of their friends just did one of the exercises.  This could potentially motivate a minimum of 1 other person to out beat or match that.  And so what could happen is that once 1 other person competes, others may join and be miles away from each other.

    1. Small groups:

    Consider a scenario where a family of parents and their children uses the application.  The parents set up their account then after they set up a group called “Family.”  Within that group are the tasks where for this example, the administrators (the parents) create a goal called “Disney World Trip.”  The application would then prompt the administrators to distinguish how the goal to go to Disney World can be achieved by designating points that are linked to real-life tasks and activities.  Here is the distribution of points:

      1. Clean Room:    2 points
      2. Practice your Instrument:  3 points
      3. Read a book:  15 points
      4. Get 1 A in the semester:  15 points
      5. Get 2 A’s in the semester:  30 points
      6. Get 3A’s in the semester:  80 points
      7. Get 4 A’s in the semester:  200 points

    In this example, let’s say that in order for the kids to go to Disney World, they must earn 200 accumulated points and the administrator decided that for every 20 points, the group members (in this case the kids), will receive an electronic badge.  This allows for the individual group members to pick and choose how they will achieve the 200 points where one child can do it by cleaning their room 100 times, or receiving straight A’s in the semester or a combination of the in-betweens.  The badges that are awarded mark their progression towards the ultimate prize- “Go to Disney World”.

    1. Larger groups:

    For this example the organization that will represent a large-group scenario will be a Community Service Program in a high school.  At Teaneck High school, a silver sash titled “Community Service Honor” is awarded to graduates that complete a certain number of community service hours in their senior year.  Professional organizations that participate by allowing High School seniors to donate their services and are responsible for signing off on those hours can alternatively use the Badgeus App to designate badges that measure completed service hours.  Teaneck High school can use this system to better control how and where their students complete their community service hours that in many cases take place outside of the school.  Collectively the badges that are awarded mark their progression towards the ultimate prize- “The Silver Sash-Community Service Honor”.  Another example of how the application can be adopted by existing organizations is the boy’s and girl’s scout where the issuance of badges is modernized to an electronic form.

    The above example scenarios for the use of the Badgeus App are all different in scope and usage.  This is very important for the success of the application because it must be adaptable for various situations and the users are given customizable freedom to decide their individual or community goals.  The use of electronic badges can help to assess, but are not limited to, academic and extracurricular activities.  It can also be implemented in existing systems simply by having all involved parties download it on their mobile device.  

    Risks & Challenges

    A major challenge is finding the funding that will help to sustain the growth of the application without putting it to a halt between developments to other devices.  By only supplying the application on the iPhone as it currently stands, can potentially jeopardize the goal to integrate the use of electronic badges in organizations such as schools because simply not everyone has an iPhone.  It limits the social component of the application that would make is successful.  If at the very least I would like to see the application be developed on the Android Mobile phone as soon as the iPhone development is done, or even simultaneously would be awesome!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      In the case of Badger, monetary contribution is great, but the value of spreading the word is probably way important.  If you like the concept and want to see how you can help all you have to do at minimum is tell all your friends, your friends's friends, and so fourth.  Any help is truly appreciated and hold a lot of merit.  Join the fun of being one of the first people in this development!

      ~ About Hakim Azly ~

      In the Spring of 2014 I took a course on E-Commerce where the final project was to create a business proposal.  Then a few months later, here I am telling my story on a crowd funding site.  My name is Hakim Azly and my passion is in design - particular in social design within the field of education.  I have a background in Architecture where I graduated with a B.Arch at Temple University and currently pursuing a Masters in Computer Science.
