There are lots of testimonials on the ceremonies in German. Some examples translated into English: 
"I felt very powerful energies. I also noticed a formerly unknown amount of physical energy in my body and sitting still is very difficult for me!" Gabriela D'Amico
"I felt a lot of energy in my body, soft, warm, very subtle. But the strongest effect i noticed was in the Solarplexus, where I felt an anchoring in the deep being of my true self. I felt so deeply, how much power I have there. I'm still feeling this" Martin Engler
"During this ceremony I felt lots of very soft and subtle energies (not meaning this was weak at all!) They worked especially on my lower back, where I have a huge scar. The energy was working there and in my left hip. I still noticed hours later! Then my pelvis got very warm and the energy rose quite a bit up my spine! I felt so fantastic the next day and the scar feels different since then!" Ilka Mischak
Der Einfluss, den die Zeremonie auf dich und die Welt haben wird
Wir haben seit Ende Oktober 2011 öffentliche Zeremonien zu besonderen Anlässen und an speziellen Plätzen durchgeführt! Mehr dazu auf www.2012-insider.info/blog wo Du auch Videos und Erfahrungsberichte von Teilnehmern findest! Alles diese Zeremonien waren tief verbunden damit, die Energie der Erde zu erhöhen, sowie die der Teilnehmer!
La influencia de esta ceremonia a ti y al mundo
Desde Octubre 2011 hemos hecho muchas ceremonias publicas para fechas especiales y en lugares especiales y muy energeticos. Hay muchas publicaciones sobre eso en el blog aleman de www.2012-insider.info
Aqui tienes una entrevista que Alexander ha hecho con el curandero Peruano Wladimiro Murayari: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FB5prcrnnmo


Other Ways You Can Help
Well, maybe you read all this, but just can’t contribute. That doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please  get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that’s all there is to it. We're looking forward to celebrating this summer solstice and San Pedro ceremony with you!
Andere Wege, auf denen Du helfen kannst
Vielleicht hast du all das hier gelesen, aber überhaupt kein Geld! Du kannst aber trotzdem helfen:

Bitte teile die Kampagne mit Deinen Freunden!
Bitte benutze die Werkzeuge hier bei Indiegogo, um die Kampagne bekannt zu machen!
Das wäre alles von uns aus! Wir freuen uns, gemeinsam mit Dir diese Sommersonnwende mit dem San Pedro zu feiern!
Tambien puedes ajudar en otras maneras
Puede ser, que has leido todo pero solo no tienes plata. Puedes ajudar todavia:

Por favor cuenta a tus amigos de esta ceremonia!
Por favor usa las herramientos de redes sociales aqui de indiegogo!
Muchas gracias y eso seria todo por el monento! Estamos feliz, quanto quieres participar en esta ceremonia muy fuerte del San Pedro por la solsticia del verano!

story:
SWAGSURF ELECTRIC SURFBOARD FOR LAKES & OCEANS. MAKE YOUR OWN WAVES!

A true rebel rides against the tide.

Rip upstream against choppy rivers. Explore hidden coves with family and friends. The SwagSurf is your ticket to shred! Or if you prefer a more chill experience, gently float your way through serene waters using the jet engine to enjoy nature on demand.

MAKE YOUR OWN WAVES

The SwagSurf electric surfboard uses state-of-the-art brushless 2800-watt D jet surf motor to propel you through the water.  Surge ahead at speeds of up to 12.5mph for up to 20 minutes on a single charge at full speed. Lower speeds will allow for longer rides.

SLICE THROUGH THE WATER

The detachable hydrofoil creates life to make ripping through waves an ultra-smooth experience with less drag for bigger riders.

CRUISE WITH EASE

Use the handheld steering strap and pre-paired waterproof remote to maneuver like a pro. Go left, right, faster, slower – all at your fingertips. 

CONFIDENTLY CARVE

Never lose your footing on the inflatable deck, made from highly durable, strong drop-stitch fabric and covered with no-slip EVA foam for comfort.

SAFE STOP DISCONNECT

If you happen to bail, take comfort knowing that you won’t be left behind. An attached ankle leash comes with a safe-stop switch. When tugged free, the safe-stop feature automatically cuts power to the motor.

EASILY INFLATABLE

Say goodbye to bulky surfboards. Use the included electric air pump to inflate your board in a matter of minutes. With a press of a button, you’ll be ready to answer when the urge to hit the waters calls! 

FAQ

How does the SwagSurf work?

The SwagSurf jetboard uses a remote-controlled brushless DC motor that draws water in and accelerates it out at the back of the board to create thrust, propelling the board forward.

How fast does the SwagSurf go?

The SwagSurf can go as fast as 12.5 mph / 10.8 knots.

How long does the battery last?

About 45 minutes at medium speed and at least 20 minutes at max speed. How long the battery lasts depends on your riding style and what type of riding you’re doing i.e. sitting on the board and cruising won’t use as much power as racing at full throttle.

Does the SwagSurf come with anything?

Yes! The SwagSurf comes with the battery, charger, parts for the hydrofoil, remote, electric pump, hand strap, an ankle leash (with attached kill switch), a spare kill switch, a repair kit, and our handy dandy user manual.

What’s a hydrofoil?

A hydrofoil is a wing-like structure that’s sometimes attached to different watercraft like boats and jetboards. The SwagSurf's hydrofoil creates lift, slightly raising the board to reduce to water resistance and make your surfing experience smoother.

Should I use the hydrofoil?

In general, yes, depending on your weight. For surfers weighing under 143 lbs. / 65 kg, the hydrofoil is not required. However, for surfers weighing 143 lbs. / 65 kg or more, the hydrofoil is highly recommended for safety and an overall better surfing experience. If you plan on surfing in relatively shallow waters, using the hydrofoil is not recommended.

Do I have to wear a life jacket?

Per U.S. Coast Guard regulations, ALL persons using this type of watercraft must wear a life jacket that will accommodate the individual’s age, height, and weight etc. Failure to wear a life jacket may result in serious injury. Besides it being a legal issues, we care about your safety. Please always wear a lifejacket and obey all applicable laws.

What does the kill switch do?

The kill switch cuts power to the SwagSurf’s motor immediately. The switch comes attached to the ankle leash, and kills the engine if it’s detached from the jetboard i.e. if you fall off.

Is there a warranty?

Yes, each SwagSurf is backed with a 1 year warranty to protect against manufacture defects. If you open it up and something’s wrong, let us know! If you have questions or any concerns our customer happiness team is standing by at support@swagtron.com 

What happens if this campaign doesn't reach its funding goals?

All the perks claimed will be fulfilled. If you purchased a perk that we can not fulfill, we will refund your money or offer you a comparable perk if that is your choosing. 

Where will the SwagSurf ship to?

This jetboard will ship inside the continental US at this time.

story:
Built with high quality automotive grade components and materials, the FOBO Bike 2 TPMS sensor is aesthetically designed to be 50% smaller and 25% lighter compared to its previous version.

 

The sensor is as small as the diameter of the penny and weighs only 7.6 gram with CR1632 battery inclusive.

        

 
 
 

WE KNOW HOW IMPORTANT SAFETY IS FOR RIDING

Optimal tire pressure is the most critical at where the rubber meets the road; for effective braking distance and road grip.  FOBO Bike 2 TPMS is the most effective device to know that you have the optimal tire pressure while you are riding.  

 

WHICH TIRE IS UNDER-INFLATED? 

Can you tell with naked eyes which tire below is under-inflated? A tire can be under-inflated by as much as 20 per cent and still look fine.  For a safe ride, it is important not to eyeball or guess if tires have enough air.  With FOBO Bike 2, you will be alerted the moment you get in Bluetooth range with the tires if the pressure has dropped below the thresholds you set.  You can also view the tire pressure on your smartphone or smartwatch without bending your knees or getting your hands dirty or even when you are riding.

 

A slow leak is usually difficult to detect and it may get you stranded in rural areas.  FOBO Bike 2 reads tire pressure in fine resolution and analyses the readings with its proprietary algorithm.  Upon detection of a slow leak, it will immediately alert the user.

When there is a considerable change of tire pressure over a short duration(in seconds), FOBO Bike 2 determines this as a fast leak and immediately sends out alerts. 

 

 

Optimal tire pressure is critical for optimal tire performance and road safety, especially while we are riding on motorcycles.  Low tire pressure can lead to tire blowout or ineffective breaking or manoeuvre.  With FOBO Bike 2, you can know in real time as it constantly reads the tire pressure and compares against user set thresholds. When there is a breach of thresholds, it immediately sends alerts via Bluetooth to smart devices so that you can take remedial actions.    

 

Summary of Alerts:

 

 

If you own more than one motorcycles, having to individually check the tire pressure is a dreadful chore.  Some valves are hard to get to without bending down or getting your knees dirty.  Would it be nice if you can just whip out your smartphone and have all the tire pressure readings in seconds?  You can view all your motorcycles tire pressure and temperature in one app, up to 19 wheels.  Moreover, you get an alert if there is a breach of threshold when you are in Bluetooth range.

 

 

         

             

 

 

This app feature will be available by June 2019.  

This feature let riders form a group ride with a planned destination, date and time. During the group ride,  riders can know the tire pressure status and the relative locations of one another in the Map View.   If you find that your riding peer is missing and see a tire pressure alert insignia by his bike profile, you know that he may be stranded at the location on the Map View and may use your help.  This is useful when cellular phone signal is not available to call for help. 

 

 

Sometimes we loan our bikes to friends and it would be nice if they can be assured of riding with optimal tire pressure.  FOBO Share, a patented function, allows your friends(Sharee) to use your motorcycle and the installed FOBO Bike 2 with their very own smartphones; this can be done for up to 100 other friends with qualified smartphones.  Just download the FOBO Bike 2 App and send a “key”/ “request” to you who will grant permission to use FOBO Bike 2 with just a click.  Sharing has never been easier.

 

 

Ever wonder if your loved one is riding with an optimal tire pressure?  When FOBO Share is in use, the owner can view the tire pressures on his or her very own smartphone even when the Sharee is riding far away.  Likewise, when the owner is riding far away on the motorcycle, the Sharee can view the tire pressures on his or her very own phone.  This is done through FOBO's patented technology.

 

 

The patented CrossPair technology enables a seamless swap from one smart device to another to monitor FOBO Bike 2. This feature is useful when changing to a new phone or just simply swapping to a different phone.  All installed FOBO Bike 2 profiles will be transferred to the new device, without the need to individually pair and install again. 

 

 

The first level of deterrent is done with proprietary nuts and wrench.  In the event that the sensor is still stolen, it cannot be installed again.   This second level of deterrent removes the economic value of the sensor.   For ownership transfer, the original owner must release the sensors from his profile using the app.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

                   

HOW TO PARTICIPATE?

1. Log in to Indiegogo – you must be log in to receive credit for your referrals.

2. Obtain a unique link for yourself. Visit the FOBO Bike 2 Indiegogo campaign page, where you’ll now find your unique link by clicking on the “link” button as shown below. You will then see a pop-up section with your unique link.

 

 

3. Share your unique link on social media, email your friends and contacts, write a blog post, or whatever you can think of to help promote FOBO Bike 2.

EXAMPLE ON INSTAGRAM: Now on #Indiegogo: FOBO BIKE 2-Truly Bluetooth 5 TPMS For Motorcycles

When someone clicks at your unique link, this is what happens:

  • He or she is taken to the FOBO Bike 2 Indiegogo page.
  • If he or she purchases one of the perks of FOBO Bike 2, a “Referral” is credited to you

For further details, please visit https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660683-How-To-Participate-In-A-Referral-Contest

Feel free to let us know if you have any questions, and happy sharing!
 

 

 

WE ARE IN PRODUCTION

 

 

Risks and challenges 

We challenge ourselves to produce a wireless Tire Pressure Monitoring System(TPMS) for motorcycles that is inconspicuous and yet robust and reliable. We want it to be like no other TPMS in the World today.  We had to choose the latest and right technologies in hardware, squeeze many components onto a tiny PCB, produce the most reliable antenna performance into a small mechanical enclosure. The FOBO Bike 2 uses Bluetooth 5 technology for wireless communication with smart devices(such as smartphones, smart watches and Bluetooth headsets) and automotive grade award winning pressure sensor that reads fine resolution of pressure.  We challenged the convention of design rules to attain waterproof standard and tested the product against stringent international mechanical & environment testing standards.  The app had to connect flawlessly with the firmware of the components and work with Android and iOS devices using Bluetooth 5, even when the vehicle is traveling at high speed!

We had overcome all these challenges and we are ready to take this product into mass production and commit to delivery.

 

 

 

About Us

We are a group of enthusiastic engineers with passion in design and creation.  With extensive experience with designing products based on Bluetooth wireless technology, we created the FOBO brand, an acronym for For Our Better wOrld.  FOBO carries a mandate to help enhance mankind’s daily living through innovative and smart products. FOBO products get in tune with Nature, by monitoring key environmental elements that interact with our daily livings or things/loved ones that we care so much about; FOBO is Sensing with Sense TM.

We had successfully launched three Indiegogo campaigns in the past, namely FOBO Tire and FOBO Bike and FOBO TAG and accomplished timely delivery to our backers.  We are confident to delivery again a high quality and reliable product in this campaign.

 

 

 

Shipping & Logistics for FOBO Bike 2

FOBO Bike 2 will be shipped worldwide. Since there are variations in shipping rates across the globe, the tier prices do not include shipping fees(unless otherwise specified). These fees are separately calculated based on the destination country and will be automatically added at the completion of your pledge on our Indiegogo campaign.

Backers are also responsible for any applicable import duties, VAT/GST/taxes, or tariffs imposed by the destination country. Please be aware of your local import procedures before choosing to back our campaign.

story:
Helping Earthquake victims through Infrastructure

We are a filming company just like any other company who want to positively impact the Earthquake victims which have been suffering the harsh after results of the Earthquake. We are internationally recognized for our commitments to our country Nepal and we want to hold all of our citizens hands in such a emotional and fearful moment which has changed this country forever. 

Our campaign is not for supplying goods or temporary relief to the majorly affected area's but is actually to make permanent safe living facility for 500 families that have lost everything in the natural disaster. Our main drive and motive has risen from the how the government body in Nepal is not giving any major decisions or helping the needed so therefore members of Kathmandu films and promised to contribute to the needed that still don't have any living facilities.

What we will do

We need your help in terms of funding to build a safe living facility for families that have been ripped apart of their pride and ownership of which they had before the earthquake. Thousands of people are considered homeless at these harsh times but yet no one or no group have made a move towards building infrastructure for the needed where they feel safe and have a small roof to cover their heads from the rain in the monsoon.

Our intention is to give higher attention to parents with small children who are forced to leave their home and are stranded on the tents with no better option.In terms of choosing whom, we will give priorities to parents with young children and elders that are unable to provide for themselves and also people who don’t have financial support. The next part to our campaign is supporting them but apparently that will come later


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help for $995,000 to build safe infrastructure for 500 families that have been impacted by the Earthquake. We are going to make the living structures in the affected area for example "Where ever a house is destroyed, We will be cleaning the rubble and properly dispose of it and build on the land of the destroyed house" which makes it comfortable for the house owner to not leave his comfortable premises.

Construction Plan

The living facilities will be made from a list of raw materials such as the following listed below; in order to lessen the risk on a maximize basis because we don’t want to risk injury if there were to be another Earthquake.

This house is an example of what we intend to make for the affected and desperate families.

What will be given

What we will do for a fact is that after the campaign is successful we will surely keep you posted along the whole journey and also make a "Contribution Wall" which will have the names of all the contributors which will be made in the premises of the newly built facility.

If we somehow we don't reach our goal we will spend everything in building as much as possible from what we receive and we will surely keep all the backers and contributors in touch at all times for updates and processes even after our campaign has ended; and if we exceed our donating limit then we will build more living facilities accordingly for more people that we know need the attention and help.

Main Cause

Our project is the most important in our perspective because we want this to be a planting seed of idea’s for all the government bodies and for all the contributors because we want to show everyone that there are different supporting methods instead of only supplying basic needs; and also that we would have to think about the future not only the beginning phase of the natural disaster.

Please do share this campaign in every possible way and help us increase the awareness for this cause and movement because we are doing this to help a lot of people and we hope you will follow us on our journey.
story_txt:
Helping Earthquake victims through Infrastructure
 We are a filming company just like any other company who want to positively impact the Earthquake victims which have been suffering the harsh after results of the Earthquake. We are internationally recognized for our commitments to our country Nepal and we want to hold all of our citizens hands in such a emotional and fearful moment which has changed this country forever. Our campaign is not for supplying goods or temporary relief to the majorly affected area's but is actually to make permanent safe living facility for 500 families that have lost everything in the natural disaster. Our main drive and motive has risen from the how the government body in Nepal is not giving any major decisions or helping the needed so therefore members of Kathmandu films and promised to contribute to the needed that still don't have any living facilities.
What we will do
We need your help in terms of funding to build a safe living facility for families that have been ripped apart of their pride and ownership of which they had before the earthquake. Thousands of people are considered homeless at these harsh times but yet no one or no group have made a move towards building infrastructure for the needed where they feel safe and have a small roof to cover their heads from the rain in the monsoon. Our intention is to give higher attention to parents with small children who are forced to leave their home and are stranded on the tents with no better option.In terms of choosing whom, we will give priorities to parents with young
 children and elders that are unable to provide for themselves and also 
people who don’t have financial support. The next part to our campaign 
is supporting them but apparently that will come later
  

What
We Need & What You Get
We need your help for $995,000 to build safe infrastructure for 500 families that have been impacted by the
Earthquake. We are going to make the living structures in the affected area for example "Where ever a house is destroyed, We will be cleaning the rubble and properly dispose of it and build on the land of the destroyed house" which makes it comfortable for the house owner to not leave his comfortable premises.Construction PlanThe living facilities will be made from a list of raw materials such as the following listed below; in order to lessen the risk on a maximize basis because we don’t want to risk injury if there were to be another Earthquake.This house is an example of what we intend to make for the affected and desperate families.What will be givenWhat we will do for a fact is that after the campaign is successful we will
surely keep you posted along the whole journey and also make a "Contribution Wall" which will have the names of all the contributors which will be made in the premises of the newly built facility.If we somehow we don't reach our goal we will spend everything in building as much as possible from what we receive and we will surely keep all the backers and contributors in touch at all times for updates and processes even after our campaign has ended; and if we exceed our donating limit then we will build more living facilities accordingly for more people that we know need the attention and help.
Main Cause
Our project is the most important in our perspective because we want this to be a planting seed of idea’s for all the government bodies and for all the contributors because we want to show everyone that there are different supporting methods
instead of only supplying basic needs; and also that we would have to think about the future not only the beginning phase of the natural disaster.Please do share this campaign in every possible way and help us increase the awareness for this cause and movement because we are doing this to help a lot of people and we hope you will follow us on our journey.

story:
My name is Jill Peck and I am a Seattle Based Photographer.  I am very passionate about photography and hope to transition my career from being part time to full time as a Commercial Photographer. There is an opportunity to attend a photography workshop in Seattle called "Survival Guide". The workshop is an opportunity to delve in, and understand what it takes to become a successful commercial artist built on a solid business foundation.

What I Need & What I Get

I need to raise $1300 which is the fee to attend the workshop. There are two different weekends available for the class (enrollment is limited, 25 seats) and I want to attend the weekend of April 10 -12. 

If I raise $1150 by February 18th I can register early and any additional funds raised will be put toward a printed portfolio. 

This will be  an amazing three days for me! This is what the weekend of the workshop will like. 

Friday: Meet and greet with the instructors and other attendees. One - On - One Portfolio reviews with John Keatley start this night as well. I am really stoked about this. John Keatley is an amazing photographer with a brilliant creative eye. I will try not to be a fan girl. 

Saturday:  Will focus on understanding the commercial industry, how it is changing, and how I fit into it. Some of the finer details will be:

Understanding the Industry, Licensing, Peer Reviews, Create & Conquer Your Goals, Bidding / What To Charge, Define Your Style, Finding A Rep,Find Your Niche

Sunday: All about building a strong brand and a solid business. Further details are as follows: 

Building a Brand, Social Media, Leverage & Strategy, Forms & Organization, Creating Personal Work, Marketing, Networking, Finances & Taxes, Building A Creative Team, Get Your Work Out There

For a more detailed description of the workshop visit John Keatley's website.

The Impact

There are many  aspects of being a photographer that are not learned while attending college, so you have to be a proactive learner. A lot of knowledge is gained by trial and error and the rest is through research and attending workshops.  By funding me, I will gain the tools that will help me  propel my career. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone may be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  •  Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • When at all possible use the Indiegogo share tools!

story: Be loved, Brothers and Sisters in Christ. May the spirit of God be with you all. I live in a village called Pathamaguluru in South India, a region where Christians are oppressed and persecuted. It is very dangerous to be a Christian in my area. Right now, The Hindu and Muslim people have cut our village congregation from access to water. If we go to the Hindu areas, our people are attacked with stones and arrows. Everyone in our congregation (including children, orphans, and elderly) have to walk three miles to a nearby village every day to bring clean water back to the village. With your help, we can purchase a water bore well pump and dig our own well in the Christian area of Pathamaguluru. If we can do this, from then on all the members of my congregation will drink clean water safely and without problems.
story_txt:
Be loved, Brothers and Sisters in Christ.  May the spirit of God be with you all.

I live in a village called Pathamaguluru in South India, a region where Christians are oppressed and persecuted.  It is very dangerous to be a Christian in my area.  Right now, The Hindu and Muslim people have cut our village congregation from access to water.  If we go to the Hindu areas, our people are attacked with stones and arrows.  Everyone in our congregation (including children, orphans, and elderly) have to walk three miles to a nearby village every day to bring clean water back to the village.

With your help, we can purchase a water bore well pump and dig our own well in the Christian area of Pathamaguluru.  If we can do this, from then on all the members of my congregation will drink clean water safely and without problems.

story:
C57 Series

The C57 is the ultimate high performance light. Constructed of titanium, carbon fiber and aluminum. An efficient LED produces up to 20 days of constant run-time. Four light settings cater to every occasion — from moonlight to high burst.

The C57 is IPX-8 water submersible. Chromium tungsten and hard anodized coatings produce a rugged, durable finish.

The C57 is the most color customizable flashlight on the planet. From the carbon tubes to the anodizing color options. Also, the LED emitter can swapped out to allow even greater customization.

CHOOSE YOUR LOOK 

How do I specify my color option?

We will send you survey at the end of the campaign to collect your color option, shipping address, additional replacement parts, etc. 

What is Cerakote?

Cerakote is a ceramic based finish that can be applied to metals, plastics, polymers and wood. The unique formulation used for Cerakote ceramic coating enhances a number of physical performance properties including abrasion/wear resistance, corrosion resistance, chemical resistance, impact strength, and hardness. Each of these properties is rigorously tested to guarantee that Cerakote products remain at the foreforont of the ceramic coatings market. Cerakote ceramic coatings utilize state-of-the-art technology to out-perform any competitive coating in both laboratory settings and real world applications. - NIC Industries  

For more information about Cerakote, visit here

The C57 is unlike any other flashlight. We start with an aluminum body then wrap the light in rugged, light-weight, high-end materials resulting in an extremely durable and strong flashlight.

Titanium

Titanium is the strength of steel, but nearly half the weight and unaffected by the environment.

Carbon Fiber

The carbon fiber provides an added layer of protection to the aluminum core, acts as an insulator, and keeps the handle at a moderate temperature in extreme temperatures.

Aluminum

6061 aircraft aluminum creates a lightweight, strong core.

Coatings

For the aluminum we use Hard Coat Anodizing and Chromium Tungsten for the titanium. 

 **Cerakote titanium end cap, heat shield and button is limited to the Snow Trooper model.

Lens

Sapphire provides an extremely hard and scratch resistant lens.  

  • Dimensions: 138 x 30 mm (5.4" X 1.18") 
  • Weight: 5.86.oz. (battery, clip and wrist strap not included) 
  • LED: Cree XP-L HD V5 Cool White CCT (5000-8300K) 
  • Output: moonlight, low, medium and turbo (1, 50, 300 and 1,000 lumens) 
  • Runtime from low to high: 20 days (480 hrs), 60 hrs, 6 hrs and 2.5 hrs 
  • Water Proof - IPX-8; 3 meters, 30 minutes 
  • Mount Flexibility: 1 inch and 30 mm 
  • Lens: scratch resistant sapphire 
  • Reflector: Orange Peel 
  • Potted Electronics 
  • Battery: Panasonic NCR18650B 3400 mAh 18650 rechargeable Li-ion 
  • Battery Options: 18650, 16340 or 2 X CR123s 
  • Button: reverse clicky, half step to change modes Mode Memory 
  • Features tail and head stand

C57 Package 

  • C57
  • 18650 battery and aluminum USB charger (optional on some rewards)
  • Microfiber bag
  • Pocket clip
  • Instruction pamphlet
  • Warranty card


Twelve months ago in a newly framed detached garage we gathered as a team and set out to create something new, something that represents our love for design, engineering and our active lifestyle.  With three key elements in mind - durability, design and performance, the C57 was born.

Utilizing the latest technology in engineering, rapid prototyping and manufacturing allowed us to quickly innovate, prototype and test various designs.  With a team member on the ground in Asia, we were able to find high-quality strategic partners that could produce the required precision we needed to manufacture a superior product- from the premium finishes to the precision machining down to the potted electronics.  

INSTAGRAM  |  FACEBOOK  |  TWITTER  |  PINTEREST


Titanium

Heat shield, end cap and button: hypoallergenic, precision machined, laser etched, natural or chromium tungsten coated (black).  

Carbon Fiber

High strength, 2X2 twill, 3K, UV protected.

Aluminum

Beautifully machined 6061 hard anodized aluminum, laser etched.  Comes in multiple anodized colors — green, pink, brown and black.

Dual Mounting Options

Clip

LED

Light source: highly efficient, Cree XP-L provides 1, 50, 300, 1,000 lumens.

Waterproof

IPX-8, 3 meter submersible, 30 min.  This light is water tight!

Heat Sink

High end copper heat sink and thermal paste keep the LED cool and  running efficiently, especially at high burst mode (1,000 lumens).

Lens

Extremely hard scratch resistant anti-reflective coated sapphire. Second to diamond, sapphire is essential to the rugged C57. 

Atlas Ring

Atlas ring provides anti-roll, wrist strap connection

Button

Full click turns on and off. Half-clicks allow quick movement through output modes.  

Beam Profile

We tested the light beam profile against a white wall at 15, 25, 35 and 50 feet. The C57 has a very nice beam profile and projects light remarkably well at distances over 50 feet.

story:
Focus on your feat—we’ve taken care of the rest.

12 bold colorways in 3 unisex styles.

Bundle and save. Plus, gift with purchase! Colorway below is shown just for detail. You can select from 12 different color options for each pair. Sizes and colors will be selected through a survey after the campaign. Note: We will be sending surveys throughout the campaign to get an idea of what sizes and colors are on order to ensure quicker production and delivery.

Our goal is to make the initial 10,000 units of socks available for holiday delivery, which we’ll be able to verify at the end of October. Once confirmed, we’ll update backers through Indiegogo, who will then be able to pay for Expedited Shipping to ensure holiday delivery.

As with any crowdfunding campaign, there can be unexpected changes to the production timeline. In the event this occurs, we will contact affected backers.

 

Hiking, camping, traveling, exploring, strolling, bowling, emailing, lounging...you get the idea. Versatility is the name of this sock game, as the Libre Socks specialize in being all-rounders with their adaptable llama blend. Play hard, and they’ll keep you cool, dry, and fresh by pulling moisture away from your skin. Keep it casual, and they’ll swaddle your feet in plush, all-day comfort from ankle to toe. We’re tired of seeing stuffy socks that take themselves too seriously, so we’re changing that right here, right now with the Libre Socks. 

With more than 110 years of experience making socks at their mill in Sheboygan, Wisconsin, Wigwam knows a thing or two about what makes a quality knit for socks. In what started as a simple solution to filling the sock needs of the hardworking folks in Wisconsin’s lumber industry, Wigwam has evolved with the demands of its customers’ occupations and lifestyles, producing advanced knits that are as varied and specialized as the people who depend on them.  By combining Wigwam’s sock expertise with our llama fibers and unique design, the Libre Sock is unlike any sock on the market.

We’ve been working with llama fiber for several years now, first as an insulation for our Kusa Collection, as well as on its own for our popular Libre Sweater. Now we’ve taken that a step further, working with Wigwam to develop a special sock yarn made from this amazing natural fiber.

Wigwam has been knitting its socks in Sheboygan, Wisconsin, since 1905. The Libre Socks are now part of this long line of quality, USA-made products.

The unisex Libre Socks feature a classic-crew, below-the-calf fit. The versatile medium-weight construction strikes a nice balance between light mapping over the top of the foot and cuff, with slightly thicker cushioned heels and toes. 

Llama fiber is sourced with minimal effects on the environment, and the sale of llama fiber acts as a source of income for thousands of families in the Andes. We’re working closely with farmers and manufacturers in Bolivia to develop a supply chain that focuses on the animals’ well-being, improves people’s lives, and minimizes our impact on the environment.  Transparency and camaraderie stand at the center of this company, with a group of employees that has grown into a family within a superb working environment and excellent working conditions. 

 

The group we've partnered with proudly holds social and environmental sustainability as the company’s core values. Its strong commitment to social responsibility is evident throughout the company’s practices and production processes:  

• It is WRAP (Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production) certified.  

• All workers receive health and retirement benefits, paid vacation, and double pay for overtime.  

• It provides food subsidies to factory workers.  

• Ergonomic chairs for all of its workers.  

• Close to 80% of its workforce are women; many of whom are the sole providers of their households.  

• Preservation of Bolivia’s strong heritage of knitting by providing job opportunities through this trade.  

• The use fiber dyes with low environmental impact.  

• A water treatment plant has been mounted by its sister company and yarn provider to treat the production’s water residues.  

• Low-carbon emissions through the use of natural gas as our main source for heating.  

• The use of biodegradable plastic bags for shipping.

When Cotopaxi first launched, we built an in-house program that would give us the flexibility to research, develop, and produce short runs of experimental product. That was the beginning of Cotopaxi Labs. Today, the Labs project gives us an opportunity to develop products that perfectly fit the crowdfunding model and allows us to reach a broader outdoor audience.

All our products are Guaranteed For Good. Your product is guaranteed to last 61 years, the average lifespan of a person living in the developing world. 

If your product does not meet your expectations in any way, we’ll work with you to resolve the issue, whether that means returning the item for repair, replacing or exchanging it, or refunding your purchase.

Davis Smith is a member of the UN Foundation’s Global Entrepreneurs Council. He was previously the Co-CEO of Baby.com.br, Brazil's startup of the year in 2012. He is a graduate of Brigham Young University (BA), the University of Pennsylvania's Lauder Institute (MA) and Wharton School (MBA). Davis is a lover of the outdoors and recently lead a team on the first successful crossing from Cuba to Florida via kayak.

Prior to joining Cotopaxi, Cheri designed technical apparel for top brands across the outdoor industry, such as Marmot, Columbia Sportswear and Dakine. She’s also a patent-holding shoe designer with designs at Nike ID and Ariat. Growing up on a sunny California farm, she fell in love with the outdoors. Today, she gets her fix skiing Utah’s famous snow, hiking with her dog Ned, or looking for the next wave on her kiteboard. Cheri holds a BA in Product Design and Development from San Francisco State University.

Spread the word! Make sure to let others know about our campaign! Thanks again for your support of everything we're doing at Cotopaxi.

 

 

 

 

 

FAQs

When will my socks be delivered?

The socks are ESTIMATED to be delivered in the month messaged in your perk. This is a crowdfunding campaign, and as such, unforeseen circumstances can cause delays (think production delays, shipping, fulfillment, etc.). If the month messaged is “ESTIMATED DECEMBER 2017”, this means that the socks could ship anytime during that month. We cannot guarantee a date that they will start shipping at this time.

Where does my order ship from?

U.S. and International orders are shipped from our warehouse in Utah.

E.U. orders are shipped from our warehouse in Germany.

What are the sock sizes and how do I know what size to get?

Find your size on this chart above and go to the left column. Our sizes are small (SM), medium (MD), and large (LG).

How do I care for my socks?

  • Turn socks inside out before washing
  • Wash in cold water
  • Do not bleach
  • Do not use fabric softener
  • Tumble dry with low heat and remove promptly

What if I want one of the bundles, but not the free item that comes with it? Can I get a bigger discount?

No, the discounts given are already higher than you’ll ever find after the campaign is over. We have these free items to reward those who purchase extra pairs/bundles

Are the colors exactly what I see here?

The photo samples that were used for the images on this campaign and the advertisements may differ slightly. The cream color in the photos is slightly darker than the actual version. The others remain very close to the colors on the images and video here. We are confident that you will love your Libre socks!

What is your refund/exchange policy?

You can receive a full refund during the initial 30 day Indiegogo campaign, or through November 3, through Indiegogo. After the initial campaign, refunds will be given as Cotopaxi gift cards which can be used at www.cotopaxi.com. To request a refund through Indiegogo, do so here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/213172367. To request a refund after the intial campaign, please email llamas@cotopaxi.com.

Can I ship to an APO/FPO Address?

Yes!

Can I use my Cotopaxi Gift Card included with my perk towards my Indiegogo purchase?

No. Gift card(s) included with any perks on Indiegogo can only be applied towards purchases online at Cotopaxi.com or at a Cotopaxi retail or popup store after the campaign.

Can I use a Cotopaxi discount code towards my Indiegogo Purchase?

No. Any discount codes are only valid online at Cotopaxi.com or at a Cotopaxi retail store.

We’re working closely with farmers and manufacturers in Bolivia to develop a supply chain that focuses on the animals’ well-being, improves people’s lives, and minimizes our impact on the environment.  Transparency and camaraderie stand at the center of this company, with a group of employees that has grown into a family within a superb working environment and excellent working conditions.  The group we've partnered with proudly holds social and environmental sustainability as the company’s core values. Its strong commitment to social responsibility is evident throughout the company’s practices and production processes:  • It is WRAP (Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production) certified.  • All workers receive health and retirement benefits, paid vacation, and double pay for overtime.  • It provides food subsidies to factory workers.  • Ergonomic chairs for all of its workers.  • Close to 80% of its workforce are women; many of whom are the sole providers of their households.  • Preservation of Bolivia’s strong heritage of knitting by providing job opportunities through this trade.  • The use fiber dyes with low environmental impact.  • A water treatment plant has been mounted by its sister company and yarn provider to treat the production’s water residues.  • Low-carbon emissions through the use of natural gas as our main source for heating.  • The use of biodegradable plastic bags for shipping.When Cotopaxi first launched, we built an in-house program that would give us the flexibility to research, develop, and produce short runs of experimental product. That was the beginning of Cotopaxi Labs. Today, the Labs project gives us an opportunity to develop products that perfectly fit the crowdfunding model and allows us to reach a broader outdoor audience.All our products are Guaranteed For Good. Your product is guaranteed to last 61 years, the average lifespan of a person living in the developing world. If your product does not meet your expectations in any way, we’ll work with you to resolve the issue, whether that means returning the item for repair, replacing or exchanging it, or refunding your purchase.Davis Smith is a member of the UN Foundation’s Global Entrepreneurs Council. He was previously the Co-CEO of Baby.com.br, Brazil's startup of the year in 2012. He is a graduate of Brigham Young University (BA), the University of Pennsylvania's Lauder Institute (MA) and Wharton School (MBA). Davis is a lover of the outdoors and recently lead a team on the first successful crossing from Cuba to Florida via kayak.Prior to joining Cotopaxi, Cheri designed technical apparel for top brands across the outdoor industry, such as Marmot, Columbia Sportswear and Dakine. She’s also a patent-holding shoe designer with designs at Nike ID and Ariat. Growing up on a sunny California farm, she fell in love with the outdoors. Today, she gets her fix skiing Utah’s famous snow, hiking with her dog Ned, or looking for the next wave on her kiteboard. Cheri holds a BA in Product Design and Development from San Francisco State University.Spread the word! Make sure to let others know about our campaign! Thanks again for your support of everything we're doing at Cotopaxi.     FAQsWhen will my socks be delivered?The socks are ESTIMATED to be delivered in the month messaged in your perk. This is a crowdfunding campaign, and as such, unforeseen circumstances can cause delays (think production delays, shipping, fulfillment, etc.). If the month messaged is “ESTIMATED DECEMBER 2017”, this means that the socks could ship anytime during that month. We cannot guarantee a date that they will start shipping at this time.Where does my order ship from?U.S. and International orders are shipped from our warehouse in Utah.E.U. orders are shipped from our warehouse in Germany.What are the sock sizes and how do I know what size to get?Find your size on this chart above and go to the left column. Our sizes are small (SM), medium (MD), and large (LG).How do I care for my socks?
Turn socks inside out before washing
Wash in cold water
Do not bleach
Do not use fabric softener
Tumble dry with low heat and remove promptly
What if I want one of the bundles, but not the free item that comes with it? Can I get a bigger discount?No, the discounts given are already higher than you’ll ever find after the campaign is over. We have these free items to reward those who purchase extra pairs/bundlesAre the colors exactly what I see here?The photo samples that were used for the images on this campaign and the advertisements may differ slightly. The cream color in the photos is slightly darker than the actual version. The others remain very close to the colors on the images and video here. We are confident that you will love your Libre socks!What is your refund/exchange policy?You can receive a full refund during the initial 30 day Indiegogo campaign, or through November 3, through Indiegogo. After the initial campaign, refunds will be given as Cotopaxi gift cards which can be used at www.cotopaxi.com. To request a refund through Indiegogo, do so here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/213172367. To request a refund after the intial campaign, please email llamas@cotopaxi.com.Can I ship to an APO/FPO Address?Yes!Can I use my Cotopaxi Gift Card included with my perk towards my Indiegogo purchase?No. Gift card(s) included with any perks on Indiegogo can only be applied towards purchases online at Cotopaxi.com or at a Cotopaxi retail or popup store after the campaign.Can I use a Cotopaxi discount code towards my Indiegogo Purchase?No. Any discount codes are only valid online at Cotopaxi.com or at a Cotopaxi retail store.

story:
Introducing The HEXAD Duffel Bags

Our company was founded on a desire to make bags that look amazing and function even better. To our core we are travelers, creators, commuters, and adventurers with a mission to make high-quality, multi-functional products. We believe that a great bag does more than carry your stuff - a great bag evokes action and facilitates adventure. And that's exactly what these duffels were designed to do.

 

The HEXAD Access Duffel

 

The HEXAD Carryall Duffel

 

 

WANDRD was born when two brothers were planning trips to different parts of the world. Spencer was headed to Paris to attend and take pictures at Fashion Week, and Ryan had rented a small camper van in New Zealand for 10 days. Both were looking for the perfect camera bag to take, but after months of research (and many purchased bags) - they decided to make their own. The PRVKE Pack was launched on Kickstarter in 2015 and over the course of two campaigns raised more than $500,000, was featured in top news sources such as Forbes, USA Today, and CNET; And received several awards for its thoughtful and innovative design.

 

 

  

 

 

The Access Duffel provides the same sleek look and durable materials as the Carryall, but features a clamshell opening that gives you complete access to the 3 large compartments inside the bag. The two bottom compartments were designed to be compatible with our existing Camera Cubes, turning this into our largest photo bag yet. Whether you are using it for photography or not, this is the perfect travel bag for those who want a little more organization.

 

We designed the Access Duffel to be compatible with both the Large and Small Camera Cubes which are the same Camera Cubes that fit in our award winning PRVKE series backpacks - the PRVKE 21 and the PRVKE 31. For those who own a PRVKE backpack with the corresponding Camera Cube can easily transfer the Cube between the Access Duffel and your PRVKE backpack.

 

More functional than a traditional duffle. More versatile than a dedicated travel bag. The HEXAD Carryall Duffel was meticulously engineered to go where no duffel has gone before. Traditional duffel bags are fine gear haulers, but lack any real organization to be great travel companions. Not only that, but they can be extremely uncomfortable to carry (unless you happen to be using them to carry throw pillows). And dedicated travel bags are great for when you're heading to the airport, but suck when it comes to anything else.  

 

 

  • Tarpaulin and Ballistic Nylon with Army Coating
  • High-Quality Weatherproof Zippers
  • Carry-On Dimensions
  • Fits Up To A 15 "Macbook Pro
  • Empty Weight: 3.9 lbs (1.8 kg)
  • Tarpaulin and Ballistic Nylon with Army Coating 
  • High-Quality Weatherproof Zippers
  • Fits Up To A 15 "Macbook Pro
  • Empty Weight: 4.6 lbs (2.1 kg)
  • Tarpaulin and Ballistic Nylon with Army Coating 
  • High-Quality Weatherproof Zippers
  • Carry-On Dimensions
  • Fits Up To A 15 "Macbook Pro
  • Empty Weight: 3.9 lbs (1.8 kg)

We have worked for months and developed over 10 different prototypes to perfect these duffel bags. 

 

 

 

From left to right: Heather (Customer Relations), Austin (Operations), Spencer (Product Development), Morgan (Social Media & Brand Communications), Ryan (Marketing)

 

Do These Bags Come With A Warranty?

And it is! Our bags come with a lifetime warranty. For the long as you own the product, we will provide a warranty against defects in materials and workmanship.

It does not cover general wear and tear or by using the item for other than its intended purpose.

Customs & Duties

We can not mark any rewards as a gift. It is illegal to do so.

Bags sent to the U.S.A. and the E.U. will not be subject to import taxes or fees, since we have warehouses that we will be shipping from inside these regions.

For other countries, import duties and taxes are not included in our reward levels. These charges vary by country and are completely out of our control. We are shipping our bags all over the world and it is impossible for us to build the various customs charges into the reward level through Indiegogo. But we love you.

This online tool can help you calculate duties. But please remember, we are not the creators of this tool so use this as an estimate. 

Http://www.dutycalculator.com/new-import-duty-a...

Return Policy?

We stand behind our bags and will replace or repair items that fall within our warranty; However, we do not offer refunds or returns on bags / products that were received as an Indiegogo reward.

Crowdfunding is an amazing tool that allows people to get their ideas off the ground. Indiegogo is not a store and our "perks" are the way that we say thank you for supporting us (and trust us, we are VERY grateful). Every dollar received from this campaign will go directly into making The HEXAD Duffel Bags a reality.

story:
Mission Nicaragua 2013

This April, 40 high school aged boys and girls will travel with the Legionaries of Christ to one of our traditional mission territories: Chinandega, Nicaragua!  We will have the opportunity to help the local priest as well as the local townspeople, bringing them the joy of Christ and our hard work to show our love for them.

We need your support!

In order to make this mission trip a success, we first and foremost ask you for your prayers.

We are also looking to raise $16,000 in order to accomplish the following:

  • $7,500
    • Build a classroom for the local parish so the priest has a place to teach catechism (last year we raised $8000 and built a rectory for the priest).
  • $7,000
    • Remodeling the school in the nearby village (getting desks, cubbies, fixing the roof)
  • $500
    • Putting on a carnival for kids that live in the trash dump (food, games, prizes, etc.)
  • $1,000
    • Purchasing and installing mattresses for the local nursing home

Thank you so much for helping us help make a difference!!  You can be assured of our prayers and only God can repay you for your generosity!

story:
Experiences vs. Products

You found us! Thank you for that, and for helping us build our dream! We are creating Wasatch Bike Park, Utah’s first indoor mountain bike and BMX park. We’re looking to take some vacant warehouse space close to downtown Salt Lake City, and convert it to become an indoor mountain bike and BMX park.

Wasatch Bike Park will have tracks, obstacles and jumps for mountain bike and BMX riders of all skill levels. We’ll also have retail sales, a full-service repair shop, a lounge, bike and equipment rentals, and more.

Utah is known as a mountain biker’s paradise, and it’s our goal to allow people to bike year-round, in a fun and challenging environment. But, the Wasatch Crew also plans on being heavily involved in the local bike race scene, as well as trail-building and advocacy efforts.

In short, we want to help make mountain biking in Utah as good as it can be, both inside and out!

We believe in this project whole-heartedly because we’re providing what the Utah outdoor community has asked for. As Salt Lake City has worked to re-develop is warehouse and granary districts over the past decade, the conventional wisdom has undergone a shift from wanting a fancy-new-place to “buy” stuff, to wanting open & public space to “do” stuff.

Through your generosity, it will allow the Wasatch Bike Park crew to build the park over the summer, and get it ready to open next fall—just when Utah’s winter is kicking in!

Why indiegogo!?

We’re asking for a good chunk of money. We’re doing this for two huge reasons: First, like you, we want this project up and running, and 100% complete, as fast as possible.  Second, we want our community, and other like-minded individuals, to be able to reap the rewards and share in our successes.

Our goal for this campaign is to raise the capital needed to catapult the project to the next level. We’re aggressively pursuing funding from multiple resources, and this will help speed up the process! It will also help facilitate park design, and the purchasing of materials to help build the park.

The breakdown of campaign funds we’re attempting to raise will be spent as follows:

  • 70% will be spent on materials such as 2x4s, plywood, nails, and other things that build a bike park.
  • 20% of funds asked will go toward building out the bathroom areas, and adding a women's bathroom (it's a warehouse built in the 60s--what did you expect?).
  • The remaining 10% will be used to build-out our shop and lounge areas.

Our Gifts to You!

If you chose to help us raise money, we will show our overwhelming thanks with gifts of gratitude! From fun little things to things that just rock, we are offering up the following perks to our generous benefactors:

  • Tee-Shirts and Stickers with our pretty sweet logo!
  • Day, Month, and even Season Passes to the bike park!
  • Free Tune-Up (a $40 value)!
  • Naming rights for specific sections of track!
  • Your name on our future Sponsor Wall!

Why?

It’s because mountain biking in Utah is amazing! And people want to do it year-round.  Utah’s snow is amazing too, but mountain biking and BMX riding in it is pretty hard (if you can even access the trails and pump tracks). 

Ultimately, our goal is to weave education and recreation together, while providing access to diverse experiences throughout all four seasons along the Wasatch Front.

Not All Contributions Need to be $!

We are excited and thankful that you’ve read this far. We are immensely grateful if you chose to donate to our vision. If you can’t, we’re very grateful for your interest – and we ask you to please help us spread the word about Wasatch Bike Park!

Please like us on facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/wasatchbikepark

Please follow us on twitter:

http://www.twitter.com/wasatchbikepark

Pass the word along about our indiegogo campaign using its share tools!

And, of course, thank you!!!!!!!

story:
BOUNDARY ERRANT BACKPACK

The Errant Pack is the Ultimate Everyday Backpack. Fluid organization, modular components, and effortless access keep creative tools organized, camera gear at hand, and a space for anything and everything. It’s minimal and sleek design seamlessly transitions to suit the commuter, photographer, and adventurer.

  A pack designed to carry just about everything, constructed from fabric meant to go everywhere, and a fit and level of comfort for everyone. 

                                                           

 The Errant's harness is adjustable, comfortable, and fits everyone so you take your gear everywhere!

                                    

CLOSER LOOK AT THE ERRANT PACK

                                       

Magnetic buckles securely latch the flap down so you can access and store gear on the fly or use the YKK zipper under the flap to add that extra level of security.

   

Boundary's innovative R.M.L. strap secures your gear on the fly so you never have to worry about your gear falling out of the Errant — Effortless storage for peace of mind when keeping up with life's beat.

UNBEATABLE STOWAGE + INTUITIVE ORGANIZATION

   

   

WHY IS THE ERRANT SO COMFORTABLE?

   

BOUNDARY DOES MODULAR COMPONENTS RIGHT!

   

 

                                        

LET'S GET TECHNICAL 

                     

 TIMELINE

                                            

 REWARDS

 

 This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped over 5,000 creators make their projects a reality.

story:
My Story

My name is Melissa {Midge} Rebholz and I've been involved in cooking, growing and promoting local food for the past 10 years.  I began with a love of local ingredients and a weekly volunteer spot at my neighborhood Greenmarket in Brooklyn, NY.  I woke early every Saturday to do a local foods cooking demonstration at the market using ingredients fresh from each farmer's field.  This involvement with Greenmarket led me to a management position the following year while I also attended the Natural Gourmet Institute and received my culinary degree. 

 After spending 2 years talking to farmers almost daily I decided I could no longer live as a "groupie" and wanted to go experience farm life for myself. I moved to a certified organic farm on Long Island  for one year with plans to return to the city in the late fall.  It's currently 8 years later I've never looked back.  I fell in love with rural life and farming.  In 2015, the Urban Exodus project came by to get the full scoop on my transition from city to county and you can read all about that HERE. 

I traveled from New York City to California taking different seasonal apprenticeships and farm hand positions.  In 2013, I landed a Farm Manager position with a small non-profit in East Tennessee.  I packed up my truck in Northern California and made the cross-country trek once more.  

I found a beautiful house and property to lease on the Nolichuckey River while I managed the farm down the road and fell in love with a farmer across the mountains in North Carolina.  I have hosted AirBnB for the past 3 years as well as taking on catering gigs, held farm to table dinners on the property and taught cooking classes to at-risk teenagers in my community.  

In 2016 I took a risk and left my management position to operate my own farm, River House Farm, with my partner.  It was a challenging year and we were living in 2 different states and farming 3 different properties to make ends meet.  We started the farm on a shoestring budget and probably had the hardest year of both of our lives.   We started 2017 freshly relaxed from  a winter vacation and starting selling CSA Shares to fund our Spring expenses.   Unfortunately due to irreconcilable differences in our personal and working relationship, 2017 will be my last year working this land. 

Ultimately, we leased this land and now it's time for me to move on.  Time to explore what is out there and in the process maybe find my very own forever farm.   

What's the Money for?

I am crowdfunding to raise $10,000 to purchase a small travel trailer and a truck to tow it.  I have been looking at 14 - 18 ft. trailers which I believe can be procured for roughly $2,000-$3000 leaving $7000 for a dependable truck to pull it.  My current trusty Ford F150 has a number of repairs including replacing the rear end that I'm not able to invest in.  It also doesn't have the capacity to tow the type of trailer  I am looking for. 

Where am I going in this trailer?  To a local farm NEAR YOU!  I started an Instagram account 5 years ago and my first photo was of a direct sown patch of greens on Cannard Farm in Sonoma in April of 2012.   It got 3 "likes".  5,500 photos and 14,000 followers later there is such a strong online community of small farms connecting worldwide through this app on our phones.  We've traded stories via photos of our success, failure, heartache and resiliency.  Farmers who I've never met in person feel like family.  Folks have walked me through mechanical issues, disease and pest identification, sent me brand new rain pants, products from their farms, even money during hard times.  Most importantly this community has acted as a sound board and a shoulder to cry on in the tough times which can be ever so more intensified in an isolated rural area.  

I'd like to hit the road now to meet this vast community of farmers across our country.  

The Plan

I will reach out to farms I have followed online and folks I know from previous farms to come up with a schedule for my year long journey.  I am looking for work-trade and paid farming opportunities as well as the ability to teach cooking classes and host a series of farm to table dinners.

I'm a hard working woman and just because I won't have land of my own to farm anymore, I still want to spend the year doing what I love.  I see this as an opportunity to help others to do good work and hope there is a mutual learning opportunity there as well.  I have much to offer and I have much to learn from what other farmers are doing, young and old. 

Home to me is really more about doing what you love everyday and inner peace rather than a specific place or piece of furniture. 

I'll be starting a YouTube channel during this trip as a documentation of what living off the land and growing food for your community looks like across the USA.  Documenting recipes, farm hacks, growing practices and avenues of distribution.  I would love the final outcome of this journey to be a travelogue/cookbook project resulting from the farm to table dinners and of exploring the beauty of American's Farmland. 

Challenges

The challenge for me personally lies within re-organizing how work gets done and the balancing act of trying to do everything at once. 

For that reason, I am looking for a trailer sooner rather than later so that during this season when I have a rainy day or a few hours to myself I can incrementally begin modifying it and preparing for this journey. 

While moving around and farming in different places has been eye opening and exciting I have realized that I have put so very much of myself into places that I've had to leave.  I am raising the funds for this transportation hoping that it will allow me to later save the money I make this last year in Tennessee towards making the next land that I pour my heart and soul into, my forever land.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that its a lean time for a lot of people.  Especially farmers.  If you don't have the ability to help make this trip a reality please share this campaign wherever you can!  Social media, email....etc.  Every little share helps.  

Thank You in advance for helping make this dream come true.  I truly believe the documentation of this journey will be wide-reaching and eye-opening and I can't wait to share it all with you.
story_txt:
My Story
My name is Melissa {Midge} Rebholz and I've been involved in cooking, growing and promoting local food for the past 10 years.  I began with a love of local ingredients and a weekly volunteer spot at my neighborhood Greenmarket in Brooklyn, NY.  I woke early every Saturday to do a local foods cooking demonstration at the market using ingredients fresh from each farmer's field.  This involvement with Greenmarket led me to a management position the following year while I also attended the Natural Gourmet Institute and received my culinary degree. 
 After spending 2 years talking to farmers almost daily I decided I could no longer live as a "groupie" and wanted to go experience farm life for myself. I moved to a certified organic farm on Long Island  for one year with plans to return to the city in the late fall.  It's currently 8 years later I've never looked back.  I fell in love with rural life and farming.  In 2015, the Urban Exodus project came by to get the full scoop on my transition from city to county and you can read all about that HERE. 
I traveled from New York City to California taking different seasonal apprenticeships and farm hand positions.  In 2013, I landed a Farm Manager position with a small non-profit in East Tennessee.  I packed up my truck in Northern California and made the cross-country trek once more.  
I found a beautiful house and property to lease on the Nolichuckey River while I managed the farm down the road and fell in love with a farmer across the mountains in North Carolina.  I have hosted AirBnB for the past 3 years as well as taking on catering gigs, held farm to table dinners on the property and taught cooking classes to at-risk teenagers in my community.  
In 2016 I took a risk and left my management position to operate my own farm, River House Farm, with my partner.  It was a challenging year and we were living in 2 different states and farming 3 different properties to make ends meet.  We started the farm on a shoestring budget and probably had the hardest year of both of our lives.   We started 2017 freshly relaxed from  a winter vacation and starting selling CSA Shares to fund our Spring expenses.   Unfortunately due to irreconcilable differences in our personal and working relationship, 2017 will be my last year working this land. 
Ultimately, we leased this land and now it's time for me to move on.  Time to explore what is out there and in the process maybe find my very own forever farm.   
What's the Money for?
I am crowdfunding to raise $10,000 to purchase a small travel trailer and a truck to tow it.  I have been looking at 14 - 18 ft. trailers which I believe can be procured for roughly $2,000-$3000 leaving $7000 for a dependable truck to pull it.  My current trusty Ford F150 has a number of repairs including replacing the rear end that I'm not able to invest in.  It also doesn't have the capacity to tow the type of trailer  I am looking for.

story:
Quick & Easy Secondary Bag Strap: Stop fumbling around with complicated bungee chord systems. Both the main panel and strap attach quickly & adjust to fit a wide variety of handles and bags.

The Travel Bag Buddy gives you quick, convenient access to your essential items when you need them.

Organized & Accessible: Unlike your purse or briefcase, the Travel Bag Buddy® keeps your travel documents and important items available when you need them.

 

 

Folds Flat: The Travel Bag Buddy® folds flat into a compact RFID travel organizer, which stows easily and takes up little room in your luggage, purse or briefcase.

 

Problem: Needing to completely remove and reattach other bag straps every time you go through security, take a taxi or board the plane. 

Solution: The Travel Bag Buddy® comes off your handle, but remains attached to your secondary bag with your items secured. No more wasted time and energy. 

 

 

Standalone RFID Travel Organizer: Simply fold the strap in to use the Travel Bag Buddy® as a convenient standalone RFID Travel Organizer. Never misplace your items again!

 

We use only the highest quality materials for the Travel Bag Buddy® to survive a lifetime of travel.

The Travel Bag Buddy® is designed and manufactured using extra strong seams, edges and finishes to ensure durability.

 

 

 

The Fine Print.  

Product Warranty: We believe in the quality and durability of the Travel Bag Buddy. If the item has any manufacturer defects and can't be fixed we will replace the product with no questions asked. 

Return Policy: You have 30 days to return your product, no risk, no questions asked. If you are not 100% satisfied simply mail it back to us and we will refund you. We made an awesome product you will love so don’t worry!  

Shipping Policy: When the campaign ends, we will gather your shipping information. Once your order is ready to be fulfilled, we will send an email with your tracking information, so you know it's on the way. We take full responsibility for delivering your item to the address provided. If an issue arises and the delivery can't be completed due to a wrong address, moved without notification or you are not available, the package will then be sent back to our warehouse. In this instance, it is the buyer’s responsibility to pay the shipping costs for the redelivery. 

Customs, VAT & Duties: All items have to be sold as regular purchases and can't be marked as gifts. The price does not include any customs, VAT, GST or other taxes applicable to your country. We plan to ship the Travel Bag Buddy™ worldwide.

Here is an easy to use calculator to review the estimated costs. https://www.simplyduty.com/import-calculator.

International buyers will receive an email or letter from the proper authorities once it arrives at customs. We wish there was a simpler way, but the law requires everything to go through customs. After the customs payment is made the order will be sent for final delivery.

Risks and challenges

The Travel Bag Buddy® is a new product, and like anything you bring to market, there are risks and challenges. To mitigate these, we have done the following:

- Provide strong communication with our backers. We planned and prepared for almost a year to launch this campaign. Our timeline to provide the product is realistic and we will do everything we can to meet our goals. Still, things can sometimes get delayed. If they do, we promise 100% full transparency with the issues and we will solve them in a manner that leaves our backers happy and supportive.

- Patent pending design which has been tested and revised many times using our travels and your feedback to provide the very best for our backers. We want to bring you a product that you will enjoy and be proud to use. I know we are!
